data.title: How to Fight Garage Doors With Boom Bot
data.description: Peek Garage Doors like so with your Boom Bot, as it clears any Defender in the Link between Garage and C Site. Peeking with the Boom Bot will make it very difficult for Defenders to target both you and your utility.

data.title: How to Execute C Site With Paint Shells
data.description: Here's one way to execute and clear the C Site as Raze. This lineup will make Defenders swing out into the open, or jump up onto the platform — leaving them vulnerable.

data.title: Top A Long To Bottom A Long Double Blast Pack
data.description: This is useful for getting an unexpected angle on players on A Site, particularly toward the beginning of the round, or when you think the enemy team is lagging behind on their rotation into A Site. There is a lot of risk involved with this though, so doing this with the help of your team's smokes/other utility is ideal. Also, make sure to clear the area under the bricks yourself, or with the help of a teammate!

data.title: Retake C Site Post Plant Paint Shells
data.description: Use this Paint Shell lineup to flush out Attackers from the Cubby spot at C Long in the Post Plant. You'll have time to swing when your utility activates.

data.title: A Tower To Front Default Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for doing pick damage to players on A Site, especially players trying to plant the spike, but due to the risk, should ideally be done with the help of your teammates on Site.

data.title: B Back To Front Left B Site Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for both stopping players from planting the spike on the front left side of B Site, and stopping players from planting the spike if you are in a 1v1 situation on B Site and the enemy player is pressed for time and has to plant, with low risk to you.

data.title: B Back To Front Right B Site Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for both stopping players from planting the spike on the front right side of B Site, and stopping players from planting the spike if you are in a 1v1 situation on B Site and the enemy player is pressed for time and has to plant, with low risk to you.

data.title: A Link To Front A Site Default Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for doing pick damage to players as they push into A Site, as well as delaying the spike plant on A Site, if any enemies on site are low HP, you may even pick up picks on players who get hit by the paintshells on site.

data.title: A Tower To A Short Double Blast Pack
data.description: This is useful for quickly traveling to A Short from A Tower, however it comes with a lot of risk and should likely be done with the help of your teammates utility, when given a good opportunity to do so as they push into the Site.

data.title: How to Split A Site Through Ramp With Boom Bot
data.description: Combo your utility like so, for an easier split on the A Site. You'll be able to isolate fights and push advantages into your favor.

data.title: A Ramps Boombot Lineup For Mid Vent
data.description: This Boombot lineup is useful for clearing out the inside of Lower Vents. Be careful though, since the boom bot can be temporarily avoided by a player inside of Vents - so make sure to watch ropes as you push into A Tower at least until the boom bot is gone.

data.title: Market To Mid Vent Paintshells
data.description: This paintshells lineup is useful for doing damage to players in Mid Vent, as well making it more difficult for them to peek you from Mid Vent. To do this, align the wall on the left side of the screen, with the left edge of the box on the right side of mid top, then move forward, jump, and throw the grenade without moving your Crosshair to bounce it into mid vent.

data.title: Sewers To Mid Mail Paintshells
data.description: This paintshells lineup is useful for pushing out players in mid mail. To do this, center your character up with the line on the wall on the right side of the Sewer entrance, then line your Crosshair up with the base of the line seen on-screen on the box on the right side of mid bottom, jump, and throw the paintshells at the top of the jump.

data.title: Start Round A Main Paint Shells Pressure
data.description: Use this Paint Shells lineup to apply early pressure towards Attackers at A Main. Additionally, it will break Cypher's Tripwire.

data.title: Mid Vent To Mid Bottom Cubby Paintshells
data.description: This easy paintshells lineup is useful for clearing out the cubby on the left side of Mid Bottom. To do this, line your Crosshair up with the base of the wing on the image of the bird on the right wall of mid, run forward, and throw your paintshells.

data.title: Mid Vent Paintshells To Market
data.description: This paintshells lineup is useful for doing damage to players in Market from Mid Vent. Aim at the gap in the wall on the right of market, aim straight up until you reach the edge of a blue roof, and throw the paintshells.

data.title: Mid Mail To Mid Bottom Frog Double Blast Pack Boost
data.description: This double blast pack boost is useful for taking mid bottom control quickly, at several different stages of the round, to either get picks or just stop rotations though that area. To do this, put the first blast pack on the center of the 2nd step going up into mid mail, jump at the angle on screen and detonate it so that you go quickly/far horizontally, then glide above the base of the mid top stairs, throw the second blast pack, and then glide toward the top of the frog.

data.title: Mid Courtyard Blast Pack Boost For Mid Bottom
data.description: This blast pack boost is useful for when you are in Mid Courtyard, and want to gain vision and control of Mid Bottom/Mid Market.

data.title: Mid Cubby Blast Pack Boost To Mid Bottom
data.description: This blast pack boost is useful for when you are in Mid Cubby, and want to gain control of Mid Bottom.

data.title: A Lobby Paint Shell Lineup For A Link
data.description: This can be useful when assisting your teammates with pushing into A Link. Keep in mind you have to throw your grenade at the top of your jump to have it bounce off of the metal object on screen at the right angle.

data.title: Safe Defender Side Spawn Paintshells To B Main
data.description: This lineup is useful for when you want to slow the push from the attackers out of B Main onto B Site, from behind cover.

data.title: Safe Mid Market Paintshells To Left B Main
data.description: This lineup is useful for when you want to slow the push from the attackers out of B Main into B Site, from behind cover.

data.title: A Rafters To B Site Double Blast Pack Rotate
data.description: This double blast pack boost is useful for when you are holding A Rafters, and want to rotate to B quickly to retake the Site.

data.title: B Site Paintshells To B Main Orb
data.description: These grenade lineups are useful for stopping pushes out of B Main or doing damage to anyone around the fish box in B Main.

data.title: Mid Blue To Mid Boiler Paintshells
data.description: This lineup is useful to know if you want to guarantee that a grenade lands on top of Mid Boiler, but it does come with some risk, and you need a teammate to at least Smoke off Mid to make this work. This is somewhat easily counterable though, since enemy players can somewhat easily see where you threw the grenade from and shoot where they think you are through the smoke.

data.title: A Nest To A Site Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for stopping players from defusing the spike to the right of the boxes under the tower on A Site.

data.title: Mid Blue To Top Of B Tube Blast Pack
data.description: This is useful for getting vision of much of the map, and can help you to take control of mid especially.

data.title: Early Round Paint Shells to Garage From Yellow
data.description: Start your round with this Paint Shells lineup to isolate Attackers looking to take B Long control. You can also use this to take Initiators off their utility, or potentially kill them.

data.title: B Kitchen To Attacker B Tube Entrance
data.description: This is useful for breaking up the attackers push into B Tube, as well as getting pick damage on players in that area. Keep in mind how exposed you are when doing this though, since you are exposed to both the top of B Tube, and the underside when peeking from Kitchen here.

data.title: Mid Boiler To Top B Tube Double Blast Pack
data.description: This is useful for quickly getting on top of B Tube from Mid Boiler, especially with the help of utility from your team, to either get some unexpected picks in Mid, or retake B Site.

data.title: Back Right A Site To Top Left A Nest Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for either checking whether or not there's players in the close corner on the top left side of A Nest, or forcing players out of that corner. There is some risk associated with this though, so definitely make sure you are aware of how you are exposed, as well as what parts of site you and your team have control over when doing this.

data.title: A Site To A Nest Tower Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for either doing damage to players in the tower in A Nest, or potentially getting a pick there, especially if a player there is low.

data.title: B Snow Pile To Top Of B Tube Double Blast Pack
data.description: This double blast pack lineup is useful for quickly getting on top of B Tube, which can potentially throw the enemy team off and open up the potential for you to secure some picks from there, and increase you and your team's map control.

data.title: A Pyramid Post Plant Lineup From A Cave
data.description: This is a useful Paint Shells lineup for when you happen to be playing inside of A Cave post plant, and Cave gets smoked off.

data.title: Paint Shells Lineup For Mid Nest From B Elbow
data.description: This is a useful Paint Shells lineup for the right side of Mid Nest. Make sure that enemy players can't peek you from Mid Top though while you're setting this up.

data.title: Mid Chute Lurk To Catch Players Off Guard And Boost Into Mid Chute
data.description: This is a risky but potentially highly rewarding way to catch a player off guard who is jumping down Mid Chute if you are given information that a player is in A Hall, or suspect that a player might use Mid Chute to Rotate into Mid from A Hall, that also gives you an opportunity to quickly travel into A Hall After getting a pick.

data.title: A Hall To A Metal Doors Boom Bot
data.description: This is useful for clearing out behind A Metal Doors and some of the area between A Metal Doors, A Nest, and A Bridge.

data.title: Mid Top Boom Bot For Mid Nest
data.description: This is useful for getting a Boom Bot into Mid Nest, and then sending it somewhat into the area between mid nest and A Bridge in Defender Side Spawn.

data.title: Mid Top To B Site Paint Shells To Delay Spike Plant
data.description: This is a useful Paint Shells to delay the Spike plant on B Site after B Tunnel gets smoked off, if you're sure you're safe to set this up in Mid Top. This can only work however if you can set it up quickly enough, so it may require some practice in customs before you use it in a real game.

data.title: Mid Nest To Outside Of B Elbow Paint Shells Lineup
data.description: This quick and simple Paint Shells lineup for outside of B Elbow is useful for when you get the call that enemy players are hard pushing out of B Elbow, and you want to delay or break up the Attackers push out of B Elbow. However, make sure to only peek out when you know enemy players haven't pushed up far enough to peek you from Mid Top.

data.title: Paint Shells / Blast Pack Setup To Delay Left A Site Push
data.description: This is a useful setup to make it difficult for the Attackers to push up the left side of A Site. However, it is not a beginner setup, and so it will likely require some practice before you can use the setup in a real game - if you are not comfortable quickly lining the grenade up, and then timing the blast packs well.

data.title: Mid Pillar Double Blast Pack From Mid Nest
data.description: This is useful for quickly traveling from Mid Nest to the boost spot on the side of A Doors in Mid Pillar, and can catch players off guard if executed in the right situation. This can be really effective when used in combo with your teammates as they make a play in the area around Mid Pillar.

data.title: Boom Bot To Stop A Site Push From A Cave
data.description: This is useful for breaking up or slowing down the Attackers push into A Site from A Cave. Be careful though since you are in a vulnerable position to players spamming through the smoke seen on-screen, or running up the left side of A Pyramids, and so you will have to carefully pick the situations you can effectively use this without exposing yourself to too much risk.

data.title: Early Round Showstopper Double Pack Combo Into B Elbow From Mid Nest
data.description: This is useful for quickly pushing players in and around B Elbow and B Main back, and potentially getting picks in that area of the map since it is hard for the enemy team to avoid the showstopper in this situation when you are moving so quickly into that area of the map right after the round begins.

data.title: Early Round Boom Bot For A Shop From A Site
data.description: This is useful at the very beginning of the round for checking A Shop, or forcing lurking players there to wait to push into A Shop. Make sure to immediately get to safety after setting up this boom bot though since you will be exposed to players in A Cave after deploying it. Also be aware that Agents like Jett and Raze can catch you off guard by dashing or moving quickly forward with a blast pack into a position where they can see you in A Cave.

data.title: Defender Side Spawn To B Main Paintshells
data.description: This is useful for breaking up the Attackers push into B Main, delaying the push entirely to help your teammates hold the Site or get into more Favorable Positions, or doing chip damage to players as they come into B Site.

data.title: How to Fight Sands With Boom Bot
data.description: Here's a Boom Bot lineup you can use to peek with at Sands, it will continue to chase anyone it spots. They'll have to shoot both you, and the Boom Bot.

data.title: Paintshells through Toxic Screen to Clear Top A Site from A Main
data.description: Here's a simple Paint Shells lineup through a Toxic Screen at the A Main entrance into A Site to clear top A Site from A Main.

data.title: Aggressive Start Round Rollout to Tree
data.description: Pair up this Blast Pack play with your teammates and their utility for a strong combination. Alternatively, you can use this for a solo play with your Ultimate ability, it will be available fast enough when you arrive in front of the Attackers.

data.title: Start Round Paint Shells Arcade Control
data.description: Use this default Paint Shells lineup to pressure/push Attackers at Arcade. You can combo this with Fade's Seize or Breach's Faultline.

data.title: A Rope Delay Paint Shells for A Main
data.description: Here's a simple Paint Shells lineup to delay the attacker's push into A Main, giving your teammates time to rotate to defend Site.

data.title: How to Fight For Link Control With Boom Bot
data.description: Fight for Link Control with this Boom Bot, as it targets any Defenders playing towards spawn. You'll be able to isolate fights easier with this Boom Bot.

data.title: How to Execute A Site With Boom Bot From Art
data.description: Combo your utility like so, for a strong execute towards the A Site. Your Boom Bot will target any Defenders back site, and your Paint Shells will flush any sitting Dug Out.

data.title: Start Round Paint Shells to Market From Art
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Paint Shells lineup you can use to harass Attackers pushing from Market. Combo this utility with your teammates for an early round kill.

data.title: Boombot / Paintshells Setup to Hold Mid Doors / Gather Info Mid
data.description: Delay, info denial, and info gathering are all key concepts to keep in mind when holding Mid Doors. This setup opens up many opportunities to apply all three of those concepts, if used at an ideal time in the round.

data.title: B Site Hold Paint Shells / Blast Pack Delay Setup
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective B Site Hold setup that delays the enemy team's push onto the Site.

data.title: C Site Execute Boom Bot + Paint Shells
data.description: Use this Boom Bot + Paint Shells to entry on to C Site.

data.title: B Main Execute Boom Bot Lineup into B Site
data.description: Use this Boom Bot lineup to execute onto B Site through with your team.

data.title: A Link Door to B Site Boom Bot Lineup
data.description: Use this Boom Bot lineup to make it easier for your team to push through the A Link Door into B Site, without being punished by enemy players holding a close angle.

data.title: A Main Paint Shells + Fade Seize Combo
data.description: Use this early round A Main Paint Shells + Seize combo to get picks early in the round by catching enemy players who attempt to push through A Main quickly off guard, while also creating a window of opportunity that your team can use to gain an advantage when contesting A Main.

data.title: Delay C Site Push with These Paint Shells Lineups when Rotating
data.description: Use these Paint Shells lineups to delay the C Site Push when you are rotating through C Waterfall or C Hall from somewhere else on the map.

data.title: Early Round A Main Paint Shells to Contest Space
data.description: Throw Paint Shells in front of the Attacker A Lobby spawn barrier to contest space in A Main.

data.title: Wall + Orb for A Site Execute From A Long
data.description: Enable your team to successfully take the A Site with this strong combination of Viper utility, the orb is great for isolating Defenders trying to coordinate a retake.

data.title: Wall + Orb for B Site Execute From Outside Window
data.description: This combination of Viper utility covers both A Link and C Link, and can be used aggressively to take one of the links while the other is smoked off.

data.title: C Long Snakebite Post Plant Lineup
data.description: Use this safe, yet effective molly lineup in the post plant to secure rounds.

data.title: C Long Default Poison Orb to C Site
data.description: Position yourself like so, and perform a simple jump throw for a strong default orb. This orb is great to use to prevent Defenders from jump-spotting for information, or more added pressure to your site execute.

data.title: Spawn to B Site Post Plant Snakebite
data.description: Here's a great, safe molly lineup you can use from spawn in the post plant situation. You can make micro-adjustments to the lineup to land on the right plant spot, this one covers the left corner.

data.title: A Long Snakebite Post Plant to A Site
data.description: Here's a fast and simple molly lineup you can use during the post plant, you will not be exposed to any Defenders retaking long.

data.title: A Long to A Site Post Plant Snakebite
data.description: A good snakebite to prevent the enemies from defusing the bomb while you tick down the timer.

data.title: C Long to C Site Toxic Screen
data.description: This wall is useful for aggressively pushing onto C Site. You mostly have to worry about defending in the back of C, but you completely block off the rotations from defender spawn and garage.

data.title: C Site to C Link One Way Smoke
data.description: One way smoke to help defend against site retakes from CT

data.title: Grass to B Site Snakebite
data.description: A good snakebite to prevent the enemies from defusing the bomb while you tick down the timer.

data.title: Aggressive C Link Orb to Mid Window
data.description: Delay your throw a little later than your jump to successfully accomplish this aggressive orb lineup.

data.title: Start Round Garage Door One Way Poison Cloud
data.description: As soon as preparation phase is completed, throw your orb like so for an easy garage hold.

data.title: Standard Defender Wall for A Site and B Site
data.description: Use this simple, yet effective wall to cover the chokepoints of both A Site and B Site.

data.title: A Long One Way Poison Orb for A Site
data.description: Use this strong one way lineup to isolate A Long Attackers and A Short Attackers from executing easily.

data.title: A Site Ramp to B Site Toxic Screen
data.description: A good toxic screen to defend both entrances to A and also defend the entrance to B while only physically being on one site.

data.title: C Site to B Site Toxic Screen
data.description: A good toxic screen to defend both C Site and B Site while physically being on one site.

data.title: C Site To C Long One Way Smoke
data.description: This one way smoke is great for holding the C Long angle and makes it impossible for the enemies to contest you.

data.title: Wall + Orb for Rafters B Site Execute
data.description: Enable your team with this combination of Viper utility, as it blocks off any B Heaven player's field of vision.

data.title: Market Snakebite to B Site Pillar
data.description: Use this molly lineup to flush out any Defenders playing that powerful pillar position.

data.title: Standard B Site Default Orb From Market
data.description: Here's a strong default orb you can throw at the start of the round to pressure any B Site Defender, as you threaten a lurk or shooting B Heaven players from the side.

data.title: Market to B Default Post Plant Snakebite
data.description: Here's a simple post plant molly lineup you can throw to prevent Defenders from defusing at B Default.

data.title: A Side Attacker Default Wall to A Heaven
data.description: Here's a powerful wall you can throw at the start of the round to pressure any Defenders that are playing towards A. Essentially, this enforces Defenders to worry about A Heaven.

data.title: A Site Toxic Screen + Poison Orb Execute Setup
data.description: This Toxic Screen + Poison Orb combo blocks sightlines of Defenders through A Tower and A Screens, which are crucial sightlines to block during most of the common A Site Executes, alongside blocking vision of Defenders into A Main from A Ramps.

data.title: Post Plant A Site Snake Bite Lineup from A Lobby
data.description: Here's a post plant Snake Bite lineup for A Site from A Lobby, that can be used for two different common spike plant spots on Site.

data.title: Start Round Orb From Screens to A Main
data.description: Use this orb lineup a little bit before the barrier drops for a standard smoke at A Main.

data.title: Aggressive Defender Ropes Wall to Mid
data.description: Here's a wall you can throw during preparation phase to aggressively fight for mid control. This wall allows both Mail and Ropes players to coordinate and fight together.

data.title: Early Round Defender Mail Pit to Mid
data.description: Here's a solid start round Viper ultimate you can use to effectively lockdown Mid.

data.title: Start Round One Way Orb For Mail
data.description: Throw your orb when the barrier drops like so, for a strong one way that prevents any Attackers from taking B Heaven control easily.

data.title: Start Round One Way Orb For B Main
data.description: Throw your orb when the barrier drops like so, for a powerful one way at B Main. This is more effective when you are on top of the small barrels back site.

data.title: Standard Defender Wall for Mid and A
data.description: Throw this wall during preparation phase for a solid default wall that blocks A Main, Ramp, and Mid.

data.title: B Main + Mid Top Toxic Screen
data.description: Here's a Toxic screen that can delay / make it more difficult for Attackers to push through both Mid, as well as B Main.

data.title: Hut to B Site Post Plant Snakebite
data.description: Here's a simple post plant molly lineup that is safe, as it lets you play outside of B Main.

data.title: Start Round Tiles to Mid Poison Cloud
data.description: Use this start round lineup to ensure easier control of mid. This orb is great for defaulting, as you get to choose when it goes up or down. You can use it to take mid control, or cross from tiles to cat.

data.title: Standard Orb + Wall For A Site Execute
data.description: Here's a standard smoke setup for the A Site, as your wall covers door and orb for heaven. Due note though, Defenders may hide hell.

data.title: Standard Orb + Wall Combo For B Site Execute
data.description: Here's a standard smoke setup for the B Site, as your wall covers market and orb for spawn. Be careful though, Defenders can potentially hide and tuck in the corner of B Main. On the mini-map, in the video, the danger ping highlights the aforementioned spot.

data.title: Early Round Tiles to Cat Poison Cloud
data.description: Use this start round lineup to ensure easier control of mid. This smoke is great for defaulting, as you choose when to put it up/down.

data.title: B Main to B Site Post Plant Snake Bite
data.description: A good Snake Bite lineup to play post plant and delay the defuse.

data.title: A Main to A Site Post Plant Snake Bite
data.description: A good Snake Bite lineup to use during post plant and when enemies tap the Spike.

data.title: B Site One Way Smoke for Defender Spawn
data.description: This smoke allows you to see the feet of anyone pushing through the CT door to B Site.

data.title: Viper's Pit For Tree + Cat
data.description: Here's a strong placement of Viper's ultimate at the start of the round. You can place your orb A Main and your wall for the mid arch + B Main. This ultimate is great, as it effectively shuts down Cat and has a bit of space for the A Site. Look to punish Attackers closing the door.

data.title: Early Round Defender Market One Way
data.description: A strong combination of Viper's utility that covers three major parts of Ascent. This setup allows you to play market and molly B Main if needed, or rotate through spawn to A with your wall up.

data.title: Default Toxic Screen For Defense
data.description: Place this wall during preparation phase, it acts as a smoke for both the choke points on B Main and Tree.

data.title: Anchor Orb + Wall For Choke
data.description: Here's a standard combination of Viper's utility for defense. This setup is not limited to you playing on the A Site, but make sure to communicate with your team on when to put the utility up / when it's going down.

data.title: B Site Hallway One Way Smoke
data.description: This one way smoke lets you see the feet of anyone pushing through the T side door to B site if you stand on the stairs.

data.title: A Site One Way Poison Cloud to Tree Room
data.description: This one way smoke lets you see the feet of anyone pushing through the door to A site from tree.

data.title: Standard Mid Poison Cloud For Lurking
data.description: Here's a strong, standard lineup you can use to deny information while simultaneously setting up a lurk. This orb is very powerful since you have three different routes to pick from to lurk, and will pull a Defender or their utility to maintain the mid space.

data.title: B Long Post Plant Snake Bite From Garage
data.description: Position yourself like so, aim your crosshair in between the edges, and shoot for a fast post plant molly.

data.title: Top B Site Pit for Post Plant
data.description: A difficult, yet rewarding Viper's Pit that can be used to secure a round. This is a very situational ultimate, but when pulled off, it is extremely tough for Defenders to successfully retake. The ultimate covers any Defender trying to retake through the rope or kitchen, so make sure you look to plant top site.

data.title: Poison Cloud For Boiler Lineup
data.description: Position yourself like so, and use this lineup for any aggressive mid purposes. This orb can be used for a B Split, along with your wall at mid.

data.title: Mid Blue To B Snowpile Toxic Screen
data.description: This Toxic Screen lineup is simple and extremely useful for getting mid control, the enemy team will now always have to be aware of someone on your team lurking mid every time you put the wall up.

data.title: T Spawn To Top A Site Nest Snakebite
data.description: This Snakebite lineup is useful for safely stopping players from defusing the Spike that has been planted on the top of the nest on A Site.

data.title: A Belt To A Default Post Plant Snakebite
data.description: This Snakebite lineup is useful for stopping the enemy team from defusing the Spike in a post-plant situation when the Spike has been planted on A Default.

data.title: A Nest To A Site Snakebite
data.description: This Snakebite lineup is useful for stopping players from defusing the Spike when planted on A Site default.

data.title: Attacker Side Spawn To A Site Poison Cloud
data.description: This Poison Cloud lineup is useful for blocking the enemy player's vision in the tower on A Site.

data.title: Yellow Retake Snake Bite From B Site
data.description: Flush out Defenders from their post plant spot at Yellow with this lineup.

data.title: Standard B Long / Yellow Setup
data.description: This is a standard set up you can use to contest for B Long initially, and then transition into retake if the situation is unfavorable. This wall is strong, since it allows you to play both aggressive and defensive.

data.title: Start Round Aggressive B Long Pit
data.description: Here's an aggressive, start round Viper ultimate you can use to give Attackers a difficult time when taking control of B. This ultimate allows you to play in a spot that watches both lanes, but be mindful of timing.

data.title: Start Round Top 410 Pit
data.description: Use this strong Viper ultimate at the start of the round to halt any rushes from Attackers. The positioning shown in the video is very difficult for them to deal with—high ground advantage.

data.title: B Kitchen To B Tube Poison Cloud One Way
data.description: This simple to execute Poison Cloud is useful for smoking off B Tube and also acts as a great one-way for anyone passing under B Tube from Mid Blue.

data.title: A Site To A Pipes One Way Poison Cloud
data.description: This one-way Poison Cloud lineup is simple and extremely useful for holding off players pushing in from A Nest.

data.title: A Screen To A Screen Toxic Screen
data.description: This Toxic Screen lineup is useful for blocking the enemy player's vision on A Site.

data.title: A Screen To A Nest Snakebite
data.description: This Snakebite lineup is useful for stopping players on the attacking side from pushing in too aggressively and can also prevent them from taking the A Site ult orb.

data.title: Mid Cannon to B Site Poison Cloud
data.description: This is a good poison cloud for B Site from Mid Cannon.

data.title: Mid Cannon to B Site Toxic Screen
data.description: This is a good wall for a B Site execute from Mid Cannon.

data.title: A Lobby to A Hall Snake Bite
data.description: This is a good snake bite to clear the corner in A Hall forcing an enemy out or getting a kill.

data.title: A Lobby to A Site Toxic Screen
data.description: This is a good toxic screen to cut A Site in half and allow you to plant the bomb.

data.title: A Lobby to A Site Snake Bite
data.description: This is a good snake bite to prevent enemies from defusing the bomb or force them off giving you time to rotate into a better position.

data.title: Mid Wooden Doors to Bottom Mid Toxic Screen
data.description: This is a good toxic screen to create a full wall blocking Bottom Mid.

data.title: B Site to Top Mid Toxic Screen
data.description: This is a good toxic screen to block both the entrance to B Site and Top Mid.

data.title: Mid Wooden Doors Poison Cloud
data.description: This is a good poison cloud to create a one-way smoke at Mid Wooden Doors.

data.title: Poison Cloud Lurk For Arcade
data.description: Use this extremely strong attack setup to allow yourself for three potential lurks, and a late execute wall for the B Site. Those three routes are shown within the video : Tower, B Site, and Spawn.

data.title: A Site Poison Cloud and Toxic Screen Execute For Rafters
data.description: Take Dish control to set up this strong A Site execute. Due note though, Rafters will be open and Defenders may look for engagements from there.

data.title: Canteen Poison Cloud + B Site Execute Wall
data.description: Use this combination of Viper's orb and wall to enable a strong execute. This utility is great for post plant as well, mixing up which piece you put up will isolate Defenders looking to retake effectively.

data.title: Drop Orb + Wall For A Site Defenders
data.description: Here's a standard combination of Viper's orb and wall to execute the A Site. The orb blocks off any Defenders in Drop, and the wall for Sands and Spawn. But, fellow Attackers running top site will be exposed.

data.title: A Main / A SIte Post Plant Viper's Pit
data.description: This is a great post Plant Viper's Pit that can make it easier stop players from defusing the spike on A Site, either by spamming the area the spike is planted to push defenders off of the spike, or using your snake bite to stop the defuse. Remember to aim far enough to the right of the pillar holding up the upper A Site platform so that the snakebite lands close enough to the Spike to stop players from defusing.

data.title: B Tower / B Site Post Plant Viper's Pit
data.description: This is a great Viper's Pit for post plant situations as an attacker on B Site. The Viper's Pit doesn't need to be 100% accurate, but if you want to completely flood A Tower with the Viper's pit, follow the lineup closely.

data.title: Upper A Site Viper's Pit To Create Lower A Site One Way
data.description: This is a great Viper's Pit for post plant situations as an Attacker on A Site. The Viper's Pit creates a one way around lower A Site that can potentially make it much more difficult for players to take control of A Site - especially if the enemy team has already had players picked off that would be helpful to clear out under lower A Site to counter the one way.

data.title: B Bench To B Arcade / B Site Toxic Screen
data.description: Here's a simple Toxic Screen for B Arcade and B Site from B Bench. This is typically a wall that you would see toward the beginning of the round, but it can used at any point in the round if timed well.

data.title: A Rope To Upper A Site Post Plant
data.description: Here's a simple pre-emptive post plant lineup from A Rope for the default Spike Plant location in the upper A Site spike plant area.

data.title: A Rope To Lower A Site Post Plant
data.description: Here's a simple pre-emptive post plant lineup from A Rope for the default Spike Plant in the lower A Site spike plant area.

data.title: B Tree To B Site Boxes Snake Bite
data.description: Here's a simple pre-emptive post plant lineup from B Tree for the Spike Plant location behind the boxes on B Site.

data.title: B Arcade To Behind B Site Boxes Snake Bite
data.description: Here's a simple pre-emptive post plant lineup from B Arcade for the Spike Plant location behind the boxes on B Site.

data.title: Aggressive Tree Poison Cloud From B Site
data.description: Here's an aggressive set up that threatens Arcade and Tree, as your smoke is effective and oppressive at denying information and control. You may go underground and harass Arcade players, or simply wait for the Tree players to get anxious to push through the smoke and punish them.

data.title: Standard Arcade Toxic Screen
data.description: Here's a strong standard set up for the B Site, your wall and mollies will make Attackers struggle when taking Arcade. The orb is used to isolate B Main attackers from Arcade attackers.

data.title: Standard Defender A Main Toxic Screen
data.description: Here's a strong standard set up for the A Site, your wall and mollies will make Attackers struggle when taking A Main control. The orb is used to isolate Dish players from A Main.

data.title: One Way Orb For A Main From Top A Site
data.description: Follow this video's lineup during preparation phase for a strong one way orb for A Main. This orb is only effective for Defenders playing stairs / top site.

data.title: B Tree Toxic Screen From B Canteen
data.description: Here's a great Toxic Screen for taking aggressive control of B Tree, or making it more difficult for attackers to take space in B Tree while some of your other teammates get aggressive or gather information in other areas of the map.

data.title: Early Round B Arcade Poision Cloud
data.description: This is a great early round Poison cloud for B Arcade. It might be better to have another player play in B Tower after you throw the Poison Cloud down however, since Viper might be better utilized in other areas on site.

data.title: A Site Retake Viper's Pit
data.description: This is a great retake Viper's Pit for A Site, that primarily makes it more difficult for attackers in A Main to stop you from defusing the spike on site, while also potentially creating an opportunity for you to get on site and clear out players on site without a main being able to stop you from pushing onto site as well.

data.title: Poison Cloud Lurk for Mail From A Main
data.description: Throw this orb lineup to pressure Defenders at Art, as it threatens and isolates the A Site player from the Art player.

data.title: Default Attacker Wall for B Site From Shop
data.description: Throw this wall as soon as preparation phase ends for a strong default wall. This wall prevents Defenders from successfully spotting your lurk to link, and can be used to execute B Site late into the round.

data.title: A Site Execute Wall for Art + Orb for Dug Out
data.description: Enable your team to successfully take A Site with this combination of Viper utility, you can choose to position your wall closer or further away to the site.

data.title: B Heaven Poison Cloud Execute From Shops
data.description: Here's a powerful lineup you can use to enhance your B Site execute, Defenders cannot peek through the orb.

data.title: B Site Default Post Plant Snakebite from B Ramp
data.description: Here's a great post plant Snakebite lineup from B Ramp.

data.title: A Site Default Post Plant Snakebite from A Main
data.description: Here's a great post plant Snakebite lineup from A Main.

data.title: Start Round Art + Double Doors Pit
data.description: Use this extremely powerful Viper ultimate to effectively lockdown mid control. This ultimate allows your art player to play inside of it, or outside and have it act as a smoke.

data.title: Double Doors One Way Poison Cloud From Link
data.description: Throw your orb, as shown in the video, when preparation phase ends for a strong one way orb at doors.

data.title: Standard B Site Defender Wall to Screens
data.description: Here's an easy, yet effective wall you can throw at the start of the round. Use this to retake, or contest the B Site. There's a little pocket for you to hide in screens to potentially make a round winning play.

data.title: One Way Orb for Art Entrance From Art
data.description: As soon as preparation phase ends, line yourself up like so and throw your orb for a strong one way.

data.title: Standard A Main Defenders Wall to Double Doors
data.description: Here's a powerful default wall you can throw to cover the entrance of A Main, Art stairs, and Double Doors.

data.title: Full Utility Setup for B Site and B Link
data.description: Here's a very effective full utility setup for B Site and B Link

data.title: B Site Default Spike Plant Denial from B Link
data.description: Here's a great way to deny enemy players from planting the spike on B Site Default.

data.title: A Site Default Spike Plant Denial from A Art
data.description: Here's a great way to deny enemy players from planting the spike on A Site Default.

data.title: Early Round Snake Bite to Contest A Main
data.description: Use one of these early round Snake Bite variations to either contest space in A Main with your team. You can use one of these 3 variations depending on where your teammates are positioned leading up to the spawn barrier going down.

data.title: Simple B Site Post Plant lineup from A Link / A Main
data.description: Use this simple Snake Bite post plant lineup from A Link / A Main to delay enemy Defenders from defusing the Spike from a position that may be tricky for them to push into to stop you.

data.title: C Lobby to C Site Default Snake Bite Lineup
data.description: Here's a Snake Bite that you can throw from C Lobby to delay or deny the spike defuse on C Site Default.

data.title: B Pillars to B Site Post Plant Snake Bite
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective B Site Post Plant Snake Bite from B Pillars.

data.title: Simple A Site Post Plant Snake Bite
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective post plant Snake Bite lineup for A Site.

data.title: C Site Delay Snake Bites to Allow Rotate
data.description: Use this delay Snake Bites to delay enemy players from freely pushing into the areas on Site that they want to push into to give your team time to rotate and retake Site with you.

data.title: A, B, and C Toxic Screen + Poison Orb Chokepoint Control
data.description: Use this setup to control several key chokepoints throughout the map on all three Sites.

data.title: C Site / C Garage Dark Cover Execute Placements
data.description: Here are the default Dark Cover placements for a C Site split.

data.title: Standard B Site Execute Dark Cover Placements
data.description: Here are the default Dark Cover placements for an B Site Execute.

data.title: Standard C Site Execute Dark Cover Placements
data.description: Here are the default Dark Cover placements for an C Site Execute.

data.title: Standard A Site Execute Dark Cover Placements
data.description: Here are the default Dark Cover placements for an A Site Execute.

data.title: A Site Retake Dark Covers + Paranoia
data.description: Use these Dark Covers + Paranoia to either make it more difficult for the Attackers to push into A Site, or to retake Site. Callout that you are using / you want to use your Paranoia before using it so that your teammates can work off of the Paranoia and take advantage of the opportunities the Paranoia can create for your team.

data.title: Paranoia to Hold B, C, and Garage from Window
data.description: Use these Paranoia Variations to make it more difficult for enemy players to push through B, C, or C Garage.

data.title: C Site Retake / Site Hold Dark Covers
data.description: Use these C Site retake / Site Hold Dark Covers to make it more difficult for enemy players to push into and then hold Site at different stages of retaking / holding Site.

data.title: Early Round Support / Info Denial Mid Dark Cover
data.description: Use this smoke to limit enemy player's options in Mid, and / or create opportunities for your teammates in Mid at the beginning of the round.

data.title: Standard B Site Dark Cover Placement + Paranoia to Push Site
data.description: Use these standard Dark Covers to help your team take control of B Site, and work with a movement duelist to combo their movement utility with your Paranoia to take control of B.

data.title: Standard A Site Dark Covers + Early Round Ramp Paranoia
data.description: Use these standard Dark Covers to help your team take control of A Site, and work with a movement duelist to combo their movement utility with your Paranoia to take control of A Ramp.

data.title: How to Play from A Tower
data.description: When playing from A Tower, use these smoke to make it more difficult for enemy players to push through key chokepoints that would allow them to take control of A Site.

data.title: How to play from B Tower
data.description: Use this simple, but effective Dark Cover + Paranoia combo to hold down B Site and make it more difficult for enemy players to push into Site.

data.title: Aggressive Bottom Mid Dark Covers
data.description: Use these aggressive bottom Mid Dark Covers to contest Mid with your team, and / or set your team up to push through market into B Site after taking control of Mid.

data.title: Early Round B Main Paranoia + B Exec Paranoia
data.description: Use this early round B Main Paranoia to make it more difficult for enemy players to attempt to contest B Main, and create opportunities for your team to push into B Main.

data.title: Bottom Mid Dark Cover to Contest Mid
data.description: Use this Bottom Mid Dark Cover to contest space in Mid. One way of utilizing this smoke is to try and set up a split A execute, by taking Catwalk control and then pinching Site after taking control of Catwalk with teammates positioned in A Main.

data.title: Standard A Site Dark Cover Placement + Simple Paranoia
data.description: Use these standard smokes when executing onto A Site, and combo it with your paranoia just before your team pushes out of A Main to create opportunities for them.

data.title: Standard B Site Dark Cover Placement + Simple Paranoia
data.description: Use these standard smokes when executing onto B Site, and combo it with your Paranoia just before your team pushes out of B Main to create opportunities for them.

data.title: A Site Default Smokes
data.description: These are two good smokes to help your team get into A Site while blocking off the other entry points into the site.

data.title: Mid Support / Control Dark Covers
data.description: Use these Dark Covers to support your team in Mid, and make it more difficult for the enemy team to contest Mid.

data.title: A Site Hold Dark Cover + Paranoia
data.description: Use this Dark Cover to delay enemy players from pushing into A Site when the enemy team is showing indicators that they are about to push into Site to give your teammates time to rotate toward the side of A.

data.title: B Main Dark Cover + Simple Paranoia to Hold B
data.description: Use this simple B Main Dark Cover and Simple Paranoia when the Attackers are executing into B Site through B Main to break up their push.

data.title: Early Round A Main One Way
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective early round A Main one way smoke that is typically used to support your teammate's efforts to control A Main.

data.title: A Main Paranoia
data.description: This is a good Paranoia to use when your teammates want to get aggressive in A Main.

data.title: B Tube to Mid Boiler Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good smoke to block mid boiler and allow your team to cross without being killed by an oper. This smoke is also nice because it allows you to see your opponent if they push forward and drop.

data.title: A Pipes to A Site Box Paranoia
data.description: This is a good paranoia to blind the entire right side of A Site during an A execute.

data.title: A Pipes to A Heaven Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good one way smoke to block the back side of site and allow your team to get into site during an execute.

data.title: Mid Blue to B Orange Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good dark cover to allow safe passage to B Orange and not let the opponent see you cross.

data.title: B Site to B Green Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good one way smoke to defend B Site from B Green. This will allow you to prevent a push and also allow you to get a pick on anyone lurking up past your smoke.

data.title: B Oranges to B Tube Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good one way smoke to get an advantageous angle on your enemy as they are pouring through under B Tube.

data.title: A Site to A Pipes Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good one way smoke to prevent an A Site push and also to get a quick kill on someone approaching your smoke.

data.title: A Rafter to A Pipes Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good one way smoke to prevent the attackers from executing on A Site and also allowing you to get a pick on someone slow peaking from A pipes.

data.title: B Orange to Mid Blue Paranoia
data.description: This is a good paranoia to get a quick pick or valuable information from middle.

data.title: A Site to A Pipes Paranoia
data.description: This is a good paranoia to blind your opponent and take an aggressive peak on them or to stop an immediate rush.

data.title: A Shop to A Site Paranoia
data.description: This is a good Paranoia for the left box on A Site from A Shop.

data.title: B Main to B Site Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good set of dark covers to block both the defender side entrance points onto B Site.

data.title: B Site to Back B Site Paranoia
data.description: This is a good paranoia for back B Site. This is especially helpful during a B execute.

data.title: A Pyramid to A Bridge Dark Cover
data.description: This is a dark cover for A Site to create a one-way against defenders rotating to the site.

data.title: Mid Nest to B Elbow Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good Dark Cover for B Elbow from Mid Nest to create a one-way smoke.

data.title: B Site Paranoia
data.description: This is a good Paranoia for B Site.

data.title: A Site Paranoia
data.description: This is a good Paranoia for A Site.

data.title: A Site Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good dark cover to create a one-way smoke for A Site.

data.title: Top Mid to Left Mid Pillar Dark Cover
data.description: This is a good dark cover for Mid Pillar to prevent enemies from pushing up one side of Mid.

data.title: Early Round Paranoia For A Main From Attacker Spawn
data.description: Here's an aggressive early round Paranoia for A Main from Attacker Spawn that's useful for pushing players out of common angles in A Main so that your team can take space in A Main.

data.title: Standard A Site Attack Smokes
data.description: Here are two standard smokes for attacking A Site that can be used at the same time, or interchangeably.

data.title: Standard B Site Attack Smokes
data.description: Here are two standard smokes for attacking B Site that can be used at the same time, or interchangeably.

data.title: B Site Smoke / Ultimate Ability Combo
data.description: Here's an aggressive Dark Cover / Ultimate ability combo for B Site that can potentially help you check, or even clear B Tower for your team as the rest of your team takes B Site. This is a difficult combo to time well - but if you can pull it off, you will save some time for your team by checking or clearing B Tower for them.

data.title: A Site Ultimate Teleport To Check B Site
data.description: Here's a great way to use your Ultimate ability to check if there are players on A Site, that's useful when you or you and your teammates are far away from A Site and you think that an enemy player could be planting the spike on A Site.

data.title: B Site Ultimate Teleport To Check A Site
data.description: Here's a great way to use your Ultimate ability to check if there are players on A Site, that's useful when you or you and your teammates are far away from A Site and you think that an enemy player could be planting the spike on A Site.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round B Bench Paranoia From B Link
data.description: Here's an aggressive early round Paranoia for B Bench from B Link that should typically be done with the help of a teammate who takes some space in B Arcade / B Bench alongside the paranoia, while potentially even challenging Attackers pushing into B Bench / B Arcade.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round A Main Paranoia From A Rope
data.description: Here's an aggressive early round Paranoia for A Main from A Rope, that should typically be done with the help of a teammate who takes some space in A Main alongside, while potentially even challenging Attackers pushing into A Main.

data.title: Standard A Site Defense Smokes
data.description: Here are two standard smokes for defending A Site that can be used at the same time, or interchangeably.

data.title: B Site Dark Cover Default Smokes
data.description: A good set of default smokes to block common defender entry points onto B Site.

data.title: B Site Post Plant Dark Cover
data.description: A  good Dark Cover for post plant that allows you to see enemies defusing while shrouding their vision.

data.title: How to Fight Art With One Way Smoke
data.description: Place your smoke as the video shown, to deny easy control of Art for Attackers. You may switch up your position to take a fight at a wide angle, or a close one.

data.title: Start Round One Way Smoke For Market
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective one way smoke that you can place at the start of the round to prevent Attackers from taking aggressive Mid control.

data.title: Mid Doors Dark Cover
data.description: A good one way smoke for Mid Doors that will allow you to see your enemies before they see you.

data.title: C Site Execute Shrouded Step + Paranoia
data.description: Use this Shrouded Step + Paranoia combo to aggressively take space on C Site while the rest of your team pushes in through the C Site Arches Chokepoint.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round A Main Teleport + Paranoia
data.description: use this aggressive early round A Main Teleport + Paranoia to increase your ability to support your team's efforts to contest space in A Main.

data.title: Standard C Site Execute Dark Covers
data.description: Use these standard smokes when pushing onto C Site with your team.

data.title: Standard A Site Exec Dark Cover Placement
data.description: Use these standard smokes when pushing onto A Site with your team.

data.title: B Site Standard Exec Smokes
data.description: Use these standard smokes when pushing onto B Site with your team.

data.title: Inner C Site Delay Dark Cover from C Hall
data.description: Use this Dark Cover to make it more difficult for enemy players to take control of inner C Site, and force them to use more risky, or more costly tactics to take control of Site.

data.title: B Main Dark Cover to Contest Space
data.description: Use this early round Dark Cover to make it more difficult for the Attackers to take space in B main, this can be done at any point in the round - but can consistently provide more info and control when used at the beginning of the round. Combo it with a paranoia if you think that will increase your team's ability to rotate and respond to the enemy team's efforts in B Main if needed.

data.title: Aggressive A Main Dark Cover to Contest Space
data.description: Use this Dark Cover to contest space in A Main with your team, and if the situation calls for it use your paranoia to make it even more difficult for enemy players to attempt to contest your team's efforts in A Main.

data.title: B Upper Retake / Delay for B Main
data.description: This is used ideally right as the enemy team is pushing into B Site, so that you can make it much more difficult for the enemy team to follow through with their execute, while also setting you and your team up for easy picks.

data.title: B Main into Site Chokepoint Delay Dark Cover + Paranoia
data.description: Use this Dark Cover + Paranoia chokepoint delay setup to delay / break up enemy players pushing through B Main into B Site.

data.title: C Site Chokepoint Delay Dark Cover + Paranoia
data.description: Use this C Site chokepoint Dark Cover + Paranoia combo to delay / break up the Attackers into C Site.

data.title: Default Dart for Garage Info From Haystack
data.description: Here's an extremely strong dart you can use for gaining information at Garage, as it will scan almost all of it.

data.title: C Site Execute Dart From C Long
data.description: Enable your teammates with this fast, strong dart when taking the C Site. You can combine your ultimate with the dart, Defenders will have a tough time keeping hold of site.

data.title: Utility Break Shockdart for Front B Site
data.description: Use this dart to break Cypher's Tripwire, or Killjoy's Alarmbot. This will provide added pressure on Defenders at the start of the round.

data.title: A Site Execute Dart from A Long
data.description: Enable your teammates taking the A Site with this dart, as you'll be able to clear most of site and the Short cubby on site.

data.title: Default Dart for A Long From Outside A Lobby
data.description: Here's a great dart to throw when contesting for A Long control. You can also use this dart for information mid round.

data.title: C Long To Right Side C Site Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a great arrow that scans the majority of C Site, with a relatively quick setup that you can do near the C Long Spawn Barrier. Be careful though, the arrow looks like it may scan players close behind default, but players can avoid this arrow if they are directly behind Default.

data.title: C Long To Front C Default Shockbolt
data.description: This is useful for stopping players from peeking C Long from the back left side of Default on C Site.

data.title: A Long To A Site Reconbolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players playing in commonly held spots on A Site from A Long and is a great support arrow for your teammates waiting to push in to A Site.

data.title: Mid Courtyard To B Site Reconbolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players in B Site including the immediate right and left side of the entrance of B Site, making it easier for you and your team to push in from Mid Courtyard.

data.title: Fast C Site Retake Dart From C Link
data.description: Use this powerful retake dart to allow yourself to scale the site with your teammates.

data.title: C Site Retake Dart From C Link
data.description: Here's a strong retake dart you can use to clear all of site, it also scans a bit into the cubby at C Long.

data.title: Early Round Info Dart to C Long From C Spawn
data.description: Use this dart for early information at C Long, or to set up a play from Garage or C Site.

data.title: A Site Retake Dart From A Link
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective retake dart that clears many key post plant positions.

data.title: Default Early Info Dart for A Lobby From A Long
data.description: Use this dart lineup to gain early information on Attackers on the A side of the map, this will scan a little bit outside the lobby as well.

data.title: Shockdart to Harass A Site Bomb Planter
data.description: Use this simple, yet effective Shockdart for the A bomb planter at Default.

data.title: C Link To Left B Site Default Shock Bolt
data.description: This is simple, but effective, Shock Bolt for the left Default Spike plant spot. Make sure you don't use this when you are exposed to enemy players in B Site, unless you are certain they have not pushed far enough into B Site to pose a threat.

data.title: Right Side B Site To Mid Window Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a great Recon Bolt for Mid Window that lands quickly, and has an easy setup.

data.title: A Tower To A Long Reconbolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players walking up towards A Site from A Long.

data.title: C Link To Mid Stairs Reconbolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players walking up from Mid Courtyard into B Site, as well as players lurking outside Mid Doors.

data.title: Defender Side Spawn To A Site Reconbolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players under A Tower and the angles within view of the back side of Default.

data.title: Default Dart From Market to Mail
data.description: Here's a strong dart you can use to default Mid at the start of the round, as it scans for any Defenders looking to contest for control.

data.title: B Split Dart For Rafters From B Main
data.description: When splitting B through Mid and B Main, use this dart to enable your teammates for an easier contest at Heaven.

data.title: A Main Dart to A Heaven For Ramp Control
data.description: When looking to take Ramp control, use this dart to enable your teammates fighting any Defender playing Heaven. This will scan the close left angle of ropes as well, but not anyone on the zipline.

data.title: A Main Post Plant Shock For Front Site Bomb
data.description: Here's a simple shock lineup that will deal full damage to Defenders defusing the bomb front site.

data.title: Sewers To Mid Vent Recon Bolt
data.description: This simple recon bolt lineup is useful for revealing players in all of Mid Vent, and unless players go into lower vents it cannot be dodged. The lineup is especially useful for forcing players who hold a tight angle on Ramen with an operator to back up into safety to shoot the bolt, because if they don't they are open to being shot from Ramen as they look down to shoot the bolt.

data.title: B Lobby To B Site Default Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players on Default B Site. Make sure to hug the wall behind you when following the lineup.

data.title: Ramen To Entrance Of Mid Vent Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players inside of Mid Vent, without players in Mid Vent being able to stop themselves from being revealed, unless they shoot the recon bolt or go into Lower Vents. To do this, stand in the corner seen on screen, hug the wall behind you, follow the lineup exactly as seen on screen, and then shoot a single bounce full charge recon bolt.

data.title: A Lobby To A Ramps Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players in most spots in A Ramps, but will not reveal players crouching behind the box on the left side of Ramps going in toward Heaven. To do this, hug the corner seen on-screen, then aim your crosshair at the top right of the billboard in A Main, and shoot a single bounce, full charge bolt.

data.title: A Lobby To A Site And Catwalk Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players in the close side of A Site, except for players behind the Site box, and players in some spots under Catwalk.

data.title: Early Round Dart For Outside B Main From Pillar
data.description: Use this default lineup at the start of the round to gain information on Attackers outside B Main.

data.title: B Heaven Shock to B Default Planter
data.description: Use this shock dart lineup to harass the bomb planter at Default, they will take its full damage.

data.title: B Site Retake Dart Back Site From B Heaven
data.description: When retaking the B Site, use this dart to scan Defenders hiding backsite or Pillar.

data.title: A Site Retake Dart From Screens
data.description: When retaking the A Site, use this powerful lineup to scan Defenders everywhere on site except for back Maps.

data.title: Lower Mid Vent To Front Mid Bottom Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for scanning players in the Mid Bottom Cubby, and some of Mid Top from Lower Mid Vent.

data.title: Defender Side Spawn To Mid Vent Recon Bolt
data.description: This Recon Bolt is useful for scanning players on the inside of Lower Mid Vent, unless they are on top of the boxes inside of Lower Mid Vent.

data.title: Defender Side Spawn To A Ramp Recon Bolt
data.description: This lineup is useful for getting information on players pushing up A Ramps, as well as scanning players in much of the inside of A Tower. Don't be careless in setting this up though, since an enemy player could easily peek you while you set the arrow up and pick you off if they have already pushed far enough inside of A Tower.

data.title: Mid Vent To Left Side Mid Bottom Shock Bolt
data.description: This simple shock bolt lineup is useful for doing chip damage to players in the left Mid Bottom corner, which can make defending Mid a bit easier, as well as do damage that leads to easier kills later in the round when retaking or defending one of the Sites.

data.title: A Tower To A Main Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players in A Lobby, as well as part of A Main, and should maybe be used alongside other similar recon bolts into A Lobby throughout a match so that players have a harder time predicting where it will land. To do this, hug the wall behind you, and follow the lineup on-screen.

data.title: A Main to Tree Split Dart
data.description: Enable your team to perform an A split with this Tree Dart from A Main.

data.title: Hut to B Site Tree Execute Dart
data.description: Use this simple, yet effective Dart to scan the most threatening Defender positions on the B Site. This lineup requires no specific spot to position, aim at the tree, and shoot.

data.title: Start Round Dart From Tiles to Bottom Mid
data.description: Here's one of many ways to default Mid on Ascent as Sova, this dart covers the Defender trying to peek Top Mid.

data.title: Start Round Dart From Cat to Bottom Mid
data.description: Here's one of many ways to default Mid on Ascent as Sova, use this lineup at the start of the round to gain fast information.

data.title: A Main to A Site Execute Dart
data.description: Use this Sova lineup to allow yourself to scale the A Site with your team for a more coordinated execute.

data.title: Recon Bolt For B Lane / B Site From B Lobby
data.description: This Recon Bolt scans much of B Lane, a large area of B Site, and much of the B Site Stairs as well. It is a great all around arrow that can not only reveal players, but also limit the movements of players within the arrow's range as well if they want to remain hidden.

data.title: Shock Bolt For Behind Dice On A Site From A Main
data.description: This is a simple, but effective lineup to land a shock bolt behind Dice on A Site.

data.title: Mid Bottom To Defender Side Spawn Recon Bolt
data.description: This lineup is useful for revealing players behind the wall that separates Mid Lane from Defender Side Spawn, keep in mind though that you need a medium bullet penetration weapon to be able to shoot through the wall that is shot through on-screen.

data.title: Start Round Aggressive Dart From Stairs to Outside B Main
data.description: Use this fast dart at the start of the round for early information, or to set up your teammates looking for an aggressive play towards outside B Main.

data.title: Mid Reclear Dart From Tree
data.description: Here's a great dart to use to help you fight mid, or update information on Attacker's rotations. This dart clears most of mid, except for fridge and past the mid-arch.

data.title: Mid Reclear Dart From Market
data.description: Here's a great dart to use if you need to update information in your round, it can also be used to spam through smokes at mid. This dart scans most of mid, it does not clear fridge though.

data.title: Cross Map Early Round Dart From Boat to A Main
data.description: Support your teammates at A Main with this cross map lineup. This lineup can be used at any point in the round, but should primarily be used reactively.

data.title: Mid Courtyard Support Recon Bolt From B Site Stairs
data.description: This Recon Bolt is a useful support arrow to help locate players in Mid Courtyard, and part of Mid Link. Be careful when lining this arrow up though, since you do have to expose yourself to B Main to set it up.

data.title: A Site Support Recon Bolt From B Site
data.description: This Recon Bolt is a useful support arrow to help your teammates on A Site either hold the Site, or retake the Site depending on the circumstances in the round. This is best used however, when you are rotating from B Lane to Defender Spawn, so that you can rotate from there to retake or defend A Site.

data.title: Shockbolt For A Site Default Spike Plant From A Rafters
data.description: This is a simple, but effective lineup to land a shock bolt on the A Site Default Spike plant spot on the front side of Generator. This may potentially delay the Spike plant as well, but the main goal of this lineup is to do damage, and potentially pick up a lucky pick if the player planting the Spike is low on HP.

data.title: Quick B Main Recon Bolt From Close B Defender Spawn
data.description: This is a quick and simple Recon Bolt to scan the front side of B Main, that is often used toward the beginning of the round. The arrow is useful for gathering information on the front side of B Main without having to play on-site to do so, either as a change up for your default setup on site, or to best adapt to the circumstances in the round.

data.title: Front A Site Cannon Retake Recon Bolt
data.description: This Recon Bolt lands on the front right tip of a cannon pointing up in the air on the front side of A Site. Landing the arrow on the right corner of the tip of this cannon can be useful when retaking A Site, since the arrow will scan the entire front side of A Site, and behind the right side of Generator.

data.title: Aggressive Yellow Control Dart From Garage
data.description: Use this dart to effectively contest for Yellow control, it scans all of the Defender positions there and a good portion of the B Site.

data.title: Default Info Dart for Crane From B Long
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective dart lineup that scans any Defender contesting for B Long control.

data.title: B Long Execute Dart to Mid B Site
data.description: Enable your teammates with this effective dart, as it scans Defenders playing Mid Site and Top Site.

data.title: Start Round Default Dart for Top Belt
data.description: This lineup is not specific, you simply shoot the arrow in the general area to gain early round information on any Defenders looking to take an aggressive engagement.

data.title: B Green to B Site Shock Bolt
data.description: This is a good set of shock darts for post plant on B Site.

data.title: A Belt To A Site Tower Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for quickly scanning players inside of the Tower on A Site from Upper A Belt.

data.title: Early Round Mid Blue To B Orange Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for quickly scanning players in B Orange at the beginning of the round.

data.title: A Nest to A Site Shock Dart
data.description: This is a good shock dart combo to kill enemies on the boxes on A Site.

data.title: A Belt to A Site Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good recon bolt to spot a lot of angles on A Site.

data.title: Mid Blue to Mid Boiler Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good recon bolt to see enemies in Mid Boiler.

data.title: Early A Site And A Nest Recon Bolt
data.description: This recon bolt is a great way to get some early information as to where the defending side players are set up on A Site.

data.title: Default Early Mid Info Dart From Pallet
data.description: Here's a fast dart lineup you can use to support teammates looking for engagements at Mid, or to mix it up.

data.title: Start Round Info Dart From A Default to Belt
data.description: Here's a great default dart you can use to secure information on Attackers at Belt or Lower.

data.title: A Rafters to A Site Shock Bolt
data.description: This is a good shock dart combo to kill someone planting the bomb on A Site.

data.title: A Screens to A Site Shock Bolt
data.description: This is a good shock dart combo for A Site.

data.title: Mid Boiler To B Green / Mid Blue Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for both scanning players near the B Green Spawn Barrier in Attacker Side Spawn, and players in and around Mid Blue.

data.title: B Hut To Mid Blue Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for scanning players in and around Mid Blue toward Attacker Side Spawn.

data.title: Recon Bolt A Belt Spawn Barriers From A Rafters
data.description: This is useful for scanning players outside of the A Belt Spawn Barriers, either as they push up the right side of A Belt, or right away as they push out of the A Belt Spawn Barriers.

data.title: A Site to A Nest Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good recon bolt to spot enemies approaching A Site from A Main.

data.title: Mid Boiler to B Kitchen Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good recon bolt to see if any enemies made it into B Kitchen through the B Tube.

data.title: B Hut to B Green Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good recon bolt to spot enemies heading towards B Site from B Hut.

data.title: Recon Bolt For Left B Site / Front B Site
data.description: This is a useful arrow to have as an option to scan the left side of B Site, and the front side of B Site, that can be used situationally alongside other lineups throughout the Attacking half, depending on how you think the defending team could be playing B Site throughout the half.

data.title: Back B Site Recon Bolt / Close B Site Owl Drone Combo
data.description: This is a great Recon Bolt / Owl Drone combo for B Site. The Recon Bolt scans Back B Site, and the Owl drone is useful for gathering information on the area close outside of B Main on site.

data.title: Quick Shock Bolt For A Bridge From A Cave
data.description: This Shock Bolt is great for doing damage to players on A Bridge in an unexpected way, especially if they are smoked off on A Bridge and are lurking inside of the smoke. Keep in mind though that this should be used after the Site has already been smoked off and your team has taken enough of Site for you to safely set up the arrow.

data.title: Post-Plant Double Shock Bolt For Right A Pyramid From A Lobby
data.description: This is a great Post-Plant Double Shock Bolt setup for the right side of A Pyramids from A Lobby. Keep in mind though that this is Double Shock Bolt setup can not be used reactively after you hear the spike behind defused, you have to pre-emptively shoot the shock bolts in order to stop someone from defusing the spike.

data.title: Recon Bolt From A Lobby To A Metal Doors
data.description: This is a great Recon Bolt to pressure players near the A Metal Doors. Be aware though, that it does not scan players behind the left Metal door, and it does not scan all of A Lever.

data.title: Recon Bolt For Mid Top From Mid Cannon
data.description: This Recon Bolt is great for quickly scanning the area outside of B Elbow in Mid Top, most of B Tunnel, and some of Mid Nest.

data.title: B Site Post-Plant Double Shock Bolt For Default Spike Plant Spot
data.description: This is a great Post-Plant Double Shock Bolt setup for the default spike plant location on B Site. Keep in mind though that this Double Shock Bolt setup is not something you can use reactively after you hear the spike being defused, you have to pre-emptively shoot the shock bolts in order to stop someone from defusing the spike.

data.title: A Shop To Opposite Side A Site Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players in most of the back side of A Site, the opposite side of A Pyramids, and the side of the Pyramids that is closest to Mid Wood Door. Be careful though, since you are vulnerable while setting this up unless you have a teammate making sure that you aren't able to be picked off while setting this up.

data.title: Mid Bottom To Mid Nest / Mid Top Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for scanning players in most of Mid Top, but also op players playing from the Defender Side Spawn Mid Nest connector.

data.title: Mid Cannon To Defender Side Mid Wood Doors Recon Bolt
data.description: This is useful for revealing players on the Defender Side of Mid Wood Doors, and that area of the Site.

data.title: Mid Cannon Recon Bolt To Scan Close B Site
data.description: This is useful for scanning players on the close side of B Site. It does take some time for this arrow to land though, so it's best used to set up for a push into B Site, or to fake taking B Site. This arrow is easy to react to, but it makes it difficult for players to easily play close to the B Main B Site chokepoint without support from their team.

data.title: Early Round Mid Top Recon Bolt From Mid Cannon
data.description: This is useful for revealing players close to B Elbow in Mid Top immediately after the round starts, or a few seconds after the round starts if you want to catch enemy players slowly moving toward B Elbow, or rotating in and around B Tunnel off guard.

data.title: Recon Bolt For A Cave From Back A Site Boxes
data.description: This is a great arrow for gathering information on players in A Cave. Try not to use this arrow in a way that's easy to read, since it lands somewhat slower and enters cave in an unexpected way. Play around with the timing to find the best situations to use it in to make it more difficult for the enemy team to react to it.

data.title: Early Round Recon Bolt For B Elbow From Mid Wood Doors
data.description: This is a great arrow to gather information on players in B Elbow toward the beginning of the round. The arrow is fast and lands in a spot that may be difficult for enemy players there to react to - you can further increase the effectiveness off the arrow by waiting for enemy players to push somewhat into B Elbow.

data.title: Recon Bolt For A Hall From A Bridge
data.description: This Recon Bolt is useful for scanning players in A Hall in an unexpected way. You can further increase the odds of the arrow getting a scan off by waiting for players to push into A Hall somewhat after the round starts.

data.title: Unexpected Recon Bolt For B Elbow From Mid Nest
data.description: This is a useful early round Recon Bolt for B Elbow, some of Mid Cannon, and some of B Main. Using this arrow can be a good way to land an arrow inside of B Elbow in an unexpected way, which increases the likelihood that the arrow will get a scan off and reveal players in that area.

data.title: Early Round Recon Bolt For Mid Pillar From Mid Nest
data.description: This is a useful early round Recon Bolt for Mid Pillar. It's primarily useful as a support arrow to give your teammates information to work with if they are making a play in that area of the map, or want to make it more difficult for the enemy team to make a play in that area of the map.

data.title: Front B Site Retake Arrow From Mid Nest
data.description: This is useful for assisting your teammates hold on B Site, and opening up potential picks through smokes placed to block vision of the front side of B Site.

data.title: Front B Site Retake Arrow From Defender Side Spawn
data.description: This is useful for assisting your teammates hold on B Site, and opening up potential picks through smokes placed to block vision of the front side of B Site.

data.title: Mid Wood Doors Recon Bolt To Scan Mid Pillar
data.description: This is useful toward the beginning of the round to scan players near the Mid Bottom Spawn Barrier / Close Mid Pillar, or later in the round with information that players are not lurking close enough to Mid Wood Doors to pick you off after you shoot your Recon Bolt and are switching back to your gun to scan Mid Bottom and Close Mid Pillar.

data.title: Early Round Shock Bolt For A Hall Zipline
data.description: This is useful for doing early round damage to players moving up the A Hall Zipline, otherwise known as A Rope. Be careful when using this Shock Bolt from this position though, since players may start to get used to this shock bolt after you shoot it the first time, and start pre-emptively setting up utility to force you to a less favorable position, or do some damage to you instead of you doing damage to them.

data.title: Quick A Site Retake Recon Bolt From Defender Side Spawn
data.description: This is useful for scanning much of the side of A Site that is closest to Cave. This can be especially useful when the enemy team places down smokes to help them push into A Site, since your teammates may be able to shoot through the smokes at the revealed enemy players.

data.title: Start Round Sands Dart A Split From Barrier Spawn
data.description: Use this dart at the start of the round to contest, or split through Sands to the A Site. This dart will not scan any Defenders tucked inside Rafters.

data.title: Start Round Dish Dart From Barrier Spawn
data.description: At the start of the round, use this dart for easy information at Dish. This will scan any Defender playing there at the beginning of the round.

data.title: Early Round Cross Map Dart From Tree to Arcade
