data.description: Use this dart to support your teammates taking Arcade control from Tree. This dart scans all of Arcade and any Defenders looking to peek from Tower.

data.title: Default Info Dart for A Main from Barrier Spawn
data.description: Use this dart at the start of the round for easy A Main info. However, Defenders can hide behind the box in main.

data.title: Recon Bolt From A Main To Clear Under A Site
data.description: This Recon Bolt is great for clearing out under A Site. Even if a player shoots the arrow before it can get a scan off, they will give away their position under A Site - letting you know that an enemy is playing from at least one of the angles under A Site.

data.title: Double Shock Bolt From B Arcade To B Site Corner
data.description: This is a great anti-defuse Double Shock Bolt for the corner plant spot on B Site.

data.title: B Tree To Back B Site Recon Bolt
data.description: This quick and easy Recon Bolt lands above the boxes in the B Site Spike plant zone, and scans many of the commonly held angles on B Site.

data.title: Early Round Info Dart for Tree From B Site Tower
data.description: Use this dart for information at Tree and a bit of Attacker's Spawn, you can use this to enable any of your teammates looking to peek from B Main.

data.title: Mid Round Info Dart for Attacker Spawn From Sands
data.description: Here's a strong, info dart lineup you can use in the middle of the round to gain information on Attacker's rotations.

data.title: Start Round Info Dart for Outside A Main From Rafters
data.description: Use this dart at the start of the round to gain information on any Attackers looking to take A Main control.

data.title: Start Round Arcade Info Dart From Barrier
data.description: Use this line up at the start of the round for quick information at Arcade.

data.title: Spam Dart Through Door for A Main From Sands
data.description: Follow this video to perform a play towards A Main, or to spam Attackers through the door without opening it.

data.title: Info Reclear Dart From Rafters to A Main
data.description: Use this simple dart during the mid round to set up a play, or to gain information of all of A Main.

data.title: A Drop To A Main Recon Bolt Variations
data.description: These Recon Bolt variations are great for scanning the inside of A Main. Keep in mind however that players can use utility, like Jett smokes for example, to hide from the Recon Bolt - and if you are too far away to hear enemy utility, enemy players may be able to sneak past one of these Recon Bolts.

data.title: Quick / Difficult To Destroy A Main Recon Bolt From A Site
data.description: This quick and simple Recon Bolt lands in an awkward spot for attackers to react to as they push into A Main, making it more likely to get a scan off.

data.title: Quick A Dish Recon Bolt To Reveal Players Pushing
Early Round Recon Bolt From A Drop To A Gate
data.description: This quick and easy Recon Bolt from A Drop is great for revealing players in and around A Gate at the start of the round.

data.title: B Site To B Tree Early Round Recon Bolt Variations
data.description: These quick and easy Recon Bolts from the B Site / B Tree Spawn Barrier are useful for scanning players in and around B Tree at the start of the round.

data.title: B Generator To B Bench Recon Bolt
data.description: This quick and easy Recon Bolt from B Generator is great for revealing players in and around B Bench, typically toward the beginning of the round.

data.title: Utility Break Shockdart to Link From Market
data.description: Here's a great, start round shockdart lineup you can use to break Cypher Tripwire / Killjoy Alarmbot at Link.

data.title: Art And A Site Execute Dart From A Main
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective dart lineup you can use to enable your teammates executing the A Site, or an A Split.

data.title: Utility Break Shockdart to Art From Market
data.description: Here's a start round lineup you can use to break Cypher Tripwire / Killjoy Alarmbot.

data.title: Quick Info Dart to A Main From Spawn
data.description: Use this dart lineup to secure fast A Main information, or control.

data.title: A Main to A Site Double Shock Dart Post Plant
data.description: This is a good spot to shoot two Shock Darts to kill anyone defusing the spike during post plant.

data.title: A Restaurant to A Art Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good Recon Bolt to scan A Art and get a pick on enemies pushing into A Art.

data.title: Mid Shops to Mid Doors Recon Bolt
data.description: A good Recon Bolt to scan behind Mid Doors from Mid Shops allowing your team to take control of the area.

data.title: Attacker Side Spawn to Mid Doors Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good Recon Bolt to assist your team going into Mid Doors and also allowing you to peek from Mid Window or hold for an A Main push.

data.title: A Main to A Site Owl Drone & A Main Recon Dart
data.description: This is a good combo to effectively use your utility as Sova to gain control of A Main and then clear the common corners on A Site for when your team begins to execute.

data.title: Attacker Side Spawn to Back B Site Recon Arrow
data.description: A good recon arrow from Attacker Side Spawn that lands at the back of B Site allowing you to scan a majority of the common angles on the site.

data.title: Start Round Link Dart to Mid
data.description: Use this lineup to contest for Mid, this dart will scan into Market and prevent Window players from taking control immediately.

data.title: Retake B Site Dart From Heaven Spawn
data.description: Use this dart to retake the B Site from Spawn, as it scans most of site and a bit into B Long.

data.title: B Site Retake Dart From Link
data.description: Here's a great retake dart to use for the B Site, it scans most of the site and a bit into B Long.

data.title: How to Support Teammates From Link - Contesting B Long
data.description: At the start of the round, position yourself like so, and shoot your dart as shown in the video. This dart will be able to provide support for your teammates at B Long, while you remain Mid.

data.title: Start Round Info Dart From A Main Barrier to A Main
data.description: For fast control/info towards A Main, use this dart lineup to scan any Attackers there.

data.title: A Dugout to A Restaurant Recon Bolt
data.description: This is a good Recon Bolt to scan A Restaurant and portions of A Main both early into the round and later into the round if you suspect a rotate.

data.title: B Main Execute Owl Drone
data.description: Use this to clear close angles in B Main and B Site during a B Site push.

data.title: Early Round A Main Recon Bolt to Contest Chokepoint
data.description: Use this simple Recon Bolt at the beginning of the round to check if any of the Defenders are taking space in A Main. Even if they break the dart right away, that gives you valuable information.

data.title: Early Round A Main Recon Bolt from A Lobby
data.description: Use this early round Recon Bolt for A Main from the A Lobby spawn barrier to check for, or help your team counter A Main aggression from the Defenders.

data.title: A Top Owl Drone Retake
data.description: Use this Owl Drone to clear out A Drop and create windows of opportunity for your team in other commonly held angles on Site.

data.title: Quick C Link to C Main Recon Bolt to Support C Hold / Retake
data.description: Use this Recon Bolt when rotating to C to catch enemy players pushing through C Main off guard and support your team.

data.title: B Site Retake Recon Bolt from C Waterfall on Rotate
data.description: Use this Recon Bolt to support your team's efforts to retake B Site, while rotating from C toward B.

data.title: Early Round A Main Info Dart
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Recon Bolt to gather information in A Main at the very start of the round.

data.title: Simple B Site Spike Plant Walls
data.description: Here are two simple Barrier Orb variations for B Site, that are primarily used to plant the spike on B.

data.title: C Execute Slow Orbs for Back C Site
data.description: When executing onto C Site, using these slow orbs to support your duelists before they scale into site can be incredibly effective at disrupting the enemy team's in back Site.

data.title: C Site Post Plant Spike Defuse Wall
data.description: Here's a deceivingly simple, yet very effective Barrier Orb setup that makes it considerably difficult for enemy players to stop you from defusing the Spike, unless they have some form of utility to do so.

data.title: A Short Choke Point Control Wall
data.description: Here is a simple, yet very effective Barrier orb for the Chokepoint at the bottom of the ramp that connects A Short to Site. This wall makes it time consuming, and somewhat risky for enemy players to push through this chokepoint during the wall's duration.

data.title: Garage Doors Choke Point Control Wall
data.description: Here is a simple, yet very effective Barrier Orb for the Garage Doors Chokepoint. This wall makes it time consuming, and somewhat risky for enemy players to push through Garage Doors during the wall's duration.

data.title: A Elbow Delay Barrier Orb
data.description: Here's a great way to delay / make it very difficult for enemy players from pushing through A Elbow to retake A Site.

data.title: A Tower Delay / Control Barrier Orb for Defender Spawn
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Barrier Orb that can be used to delay / make it more difficult for Defenders to retake A Tower / A Screens.

data.title: B Tower Delay / Control Wall
Early Rouind A Main Barrier Orb from A Site
data.description: Here's a great way to delay / make it more difficult for enemy players to push through A Main toward the beginning of the round.

data.title: Mid Top Delay / Anti-Box Jump Wall
data.description: This wall both makes it more difficult for Attackers to push through Mid, while also denying enemy players the ability to bypass this wall using the skill jump for the box in Mid Top.

data.title: Mid Market Slow from Top Mid
data.description: If your team plans on taking mid control, throwing this slow could help secure a kill in market.

data.title: Defender Spawn Slow from B Main
data.description: This slow is useful to slow down rotators, especially if you used your wall already or plan to use it elsewhere.

data.title: B Main Wallpeek to Site
data.description: Boosting up on this box with a wall can help you find a pick, opening up the bombsite for your team to attack.

data.title: A Lobby to A Rafter Slow Orb
data.description: Position yourself in the corner, aim at the icicle shown, and drag the cursor right until it's above the left edge of the bump in the wall.

data.title: B Site Lever to B Site Entrance Wall
data.description: If you hear a bunch of footsteps B, place wall to give your team time to rotate. Combo this wall with slow orbs if your wall is broken fast. It's important not to shut the market door so your mid player can rotate, unless they have died.

data.title: Defense Mid Arch Wallpeek to Mid
data.description: This wall creates an insane angle to see all of mid from. It's cheesy and leaves you vulnerable, so only use this once in a while.

data.title: Defense Mid Arch Wall
data.description: This wall will deny attackers from pushing behind your team. Consider jumping on the wall for a crazy pickoff.

data.title: Defense Catwalk Wall
data.description: Place this wall to stop attackers from controlling A Link. You can use the box to see over the wall and jump on it.

data.title: Mid Blue to Mid Boiler Slow Orb
data.description: This Slow Orb lineup lands on top of Mid Boiler giving you an advantage when peeking from Mid Blue.

data.title: Mid Blue To Top Tube Barrier Orb
data.description: This Barrier Orb lineup can be used to boost you and your teammates onto the top of B Tube giving an off-angle against enemy players in Mid Boiler, B Kitchen, and some of B Site.

data.title: B Green To Behind B Site Slow Orb
data.description: This Slow Orb lineup will land behind B Site, slowing down enemy players that are trying to peek. This is great for post plant situations to stall for time and to stop enemy aggression when planting the Spike as well.

data.title: A Site To A Site Barrier Orb
data.description: This Barrier Orb lineup is useful for blocking off defending players on A Site allowing you to quickly plant the Spike.

data.title: A Nest To Defender Spawn Slow Orb
data.description: This is a useful Slow Orb lineup for A Screens, slowing down the enemy team from entering the A Site.

data.title: B Green To B Site Slow Orb
data.description: This slow orb lineup is useful for slowing down enemy players that are rotating through B Hall.

data.title: A Nest To Back A Site Slow Orb
data.description: This slow orb lineup will slow the majority of the back right side of A Site, including behind the generator allowing your teammates to potentially get easy kills with utilities such as Raze Paint Shells or Killjoy Nanoswarms.

data.title: A Nest To A Site Slow Orb
data.description: This slow orb lineup is useful for slowing down players peeking the left window of the tower on A Site.

data.title: B Tube To B Tube Barrier Orb
data.description: This Barrier Orb lineup is great for blocking off entry into B Kitchen.

data.title: A Site To A Belt Slow Orb
data.description: This Slow Orb lineup lands on top of A Belt, slowing down any players trying to peek.

data.title: A Rafters To A Site Slow Orb
data.description: This slow orb lineup is useful for slowing down players on the attacking side from pushing onto A Site too aggressively.

data.title: Mid Nest Slow Orb From Mid Bottom
data.description: This is an easy to set up Slow Orb for Mid Nest from Mid Bottom that you can use to limit the movements of a player with an op in Mid Nest. Be careful though, since a Jett could still peek with an op and then dash out after taking a shot.

data.title: Simple B Tunnel Slow Orbs From B Back
data.description: These lineups are both easy to do and land a Slow Orb in the same spot from both sides of B Back.

data.title: Aggressive Right A Pyramids Slow Orb From A Shop
data.description: This is an easy to set up aggressive Slow Orb from A Shop that you can use to pressure the limit the movements of players behind the right side of the A Pyramids as you and your team push into A Site.

data.title: B Main To Far Back B Site Slow Orb
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Slow Orb lineup that you can do from anywhere under the B Main archway that connects B Site to B Main.

data.title: B Main Slow Orb From B Tunnel
data.description: This is an easy to set up Slow Orb for B Main from B Tunnel that you can do without directly peeking B Main.

data.title: A Cave Entrance Slow Orb From A Bridge
data.description: This is a great Slow Orb for the A Cave Entrance into A Site. Be careful of when you use it however since you are exposed to several angles on A Site when you are in the middle of setting up the lineup.

data.title: Aggressive Sage Wall Boost For Mid Wood Doors
data.description: This is an aggressive Ice Wall boost to peek into Mid Bottom / Mid Pillar from Mid Wood Doors.

data.title: A Metal Doors Ice Wall Head Peek Angle
data.description: This is a great head peek angle into A Hall from behind the open A Metal Door.

data.title: Back B Site Ice Wall Off Angle Boost
data.description: This is a great Sage Wall off angle for B Main and B Tunnel. Be careful though since part of the Ice Wall will be sticking out in view of players in B Tunnel and B Main before they see you - so, you  may have to destroy the part of the wall that is sticking out either by yourself or with the help of a teammate.

data.title: Aggressive A Drop Wall Off Angle
data.description: Here's an aggressive Barrier Orb setup that can be used to peek into A Site from an unexpected angle.

data.title: A Drop Wall Lurk
data.description: Here's a great way to potentially catch enemy players off guard as they push into A Drop.

data.title: B Generator Wall Off Angle
data.description: Here's a Barrier Orb off angle wall setup for behind B Generator.

data.title: A Site Execute Barrier Orb
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Barrier Orb that make it more difficult for enemy players in A Link to help defend A Site against an A Site Execute.

data.title: B Site Spike Plant Barrier Orb Placement
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective way to get the spike down on B Site using a Barrier Orb.

data.title: B Site Barrier Orb Boost Post Plant Angle from Mid Connector
data.description: Here's a unique, and unexpected way to play Post Plant on B Site from Mid Connector.

data.title: Retake Barrier Orb for Default B Site Spike Plant
data.description: Here's a great Retake Wall for the Default B Site Spike Plant.

data.title: Early Round Shops Slow Orb from Art
data.description: Here's an early round Slow Orb for Mid Shops from A Art, that can be used to slow the enemy team's early round aggression into Mid.

data.title: Early Round Mid Doors Passive Barrier Orb
data.description: Here's a great wall to place for Mid Doors at the beginning of the round to make it much more difficult for enemy players to push through Mid Doors.

data.title: A Link Barrier Orb to Control A Link Door
data.description: Use this Barrier Orb to control the A Link Door once it has been broken by either team, with some clear benefit in mind of the enemy team having a harder time pushing through the destructable entrance into A Link.

data.title: B Site Execute Wall / Slow Orb
data.description: Use this setup to aggressively take and deny space in and around B Site.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round A Main Slow Orb
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective aggressive early round A Main Slow Orb, that makes it more difficult for the Defenders to take space in A Main.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round C Main Slow Orb
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective aggressive early round C Main Slow Orb that makes it more difficult for the Defenders to take space in A Main.

data.title: Early Round B Main Wall to Deny Space
data.description: Use this early round B Main Wall to make it more difficult for enemy players to take space in B Main toward the beginning of the round.

data.title: C Site Delay Slow Orbs to Allow Rotate
data.description: Use this delay Slow Orbs to delay enemy players from freely pushing into the areas on Site that they want to push into to give your team time to rotate and retake Site with you.

data.title: C Site Wall Boost for Post Plant
data.description: This Barrier Orb wall boost for post plant should be used to give you an advantage in how you can hold the several angles shown in this video.

data.title: A Long Pop Flash
data.description: This curveball rounds the corner as late as possible so the opponent cannot react to the flash.

data.title: C Back Corner Molly
data.description: This molly is useful for retaking C site, clearing out enemies in back corner.

data.title: B Site to A Site Molly
data.description: If attackers are planting A while you're on B, consider throwing this molly to deny the plant and buy your team more time to rotate.

data.title: B Gong to B Site Entrance Molly
data.description: This molly slows down a B Site push and buys your team time to rotate. This is great against teams that want to quickly plant B for Mid.

data.title: A Link to A Site Cubby Molly
data.description: This molly is useful for retaking A Site after a plant. You can clear out the A Site cubby, giving you one less angle to worry about.

data.title: Aggressive Curve Ball to Push Through B Tower
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Curve Ball that can be used to push through, and / or take control of B Tower from Mid Mail.

data.title: A Main To A Elbow Hot Hands
data.description: This Hot Hands lineup is useful for stopping players from crossing from A Elbow to A Screens while pushing into A Site.

data.title: Sewers To Right Mid Top Molly
data.description: This molly lineup is useful for clearing out the box on the right side of Mid Top. To do this, follow the lineup exactly as you see it on-screen, jump, and then throw the molly at the top of the jump. Keep in mind that if your crosshair is even a little too high or too low the molly may go too far or land in a spot that won't do as much damage to players behind the box.

data.title: B Alley To Mid Site Default Hot Hands
data.description: This Hot Hands lineup is useful for stopping players from planting behind Default on B Site, and doing chip damage to them as well.

data.title: Hot Hands Lineup For B Main From B Tower
data.description: This Hot Hands lineup is useful for breaking up the Attacker's push out of B Main, or doing Chip damage to players who push through the Molly onto B Site.

data.title: B Main Curveball For Close Right Cubby
data.description: This is useful for when you want to flash the cubby close right of B Main when pushing into B Site.

data.title: B Main Molly For Mid Market
data.description: This molly is useful when taking B Site because you can stop B Market from peeking you for a brief period of time while you push into the Site. Throw the molly right after you hit your jump key for more consistent effects.

data.title: Mid Market To Back Bomb Site B
data.description: This molly lineup is useful for when you want to stop someone from planting behind default on Bomb Site B, or clear that area in general. To do this follow the lineup on-screen and throw the molly, hold your forward movement key, and jump all at the same time.

data.title: Mid Market Blaze To B Site Cubby
data.description: This blaze lineup is useful for when you want to cross into the close left B Site cubby outside of Mid Market. To do this blaze lineup correctly, try to mimic the speed at which the crosshair moves in this clip when casting the blaze, to generally the same spot seen on screen.

data.title: Mid Market Molly To B Site Cubby
data.description: This molly lineup is useful for doing damage to anyone inside of the cubby outside of Mid Market in B Site, doing damage to them as well.

data.title: B Site Molly To B Main Orb
data.description: This molly lineup is useful for doing damage to anyone on top of or around the fish box inside of B Main.

data.title: A Site to A Main Orb Molly
data.description: This is useful if you hear someone taking the orb in A Main. Position in the corner, aim at the smudge on the wall, jump, and throw. This is very forgiving but this lineup works well.

data.title: B Green to B Site Default Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good hot hands to stop the defuser from defusing the bomb.

data.title: A Nest to A Pipes Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good hot hands to push people out of A Pipes and get a quick frag.

data.title: A Pipes to A Site Curveball
data.description: This is a good curveball to blind the entirety of A Site.

data.title: A Nest to A Site Nest Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good hot hands to prevent enemies from defusing a bomb or to prevent enemies from peaking if they are inside A Site Nest.

data.title: A Nest to A Site Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good Molotov to stop the defenders from defusing the bomb during post plant.

data.title: A Site to A Nest Tower Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good hot hands to defend A Site and push someone out of A Nest.

data.title: B Green to B Garage Curveball
data.description: This is a good curveball to prevent attackers from pushing up towards B Yellow. This aggressive play can land you a kill a majority of the time as the flash is impossible to dodge.

data.title: B Main to B Site Blaze
data.description: This is a good Blaze to cut off vision and allow your team to execute onto B Site.

data.title: A Cave to Right A Pyramid Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good Hot Hands to damage enemies behind A Pyramid and push them out for an easy kill.

data.title: A Cave to A Site Box Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good hot hands to damage enemies in the corner of the front A Site Box and get them out of position for an easy kill.

data.title: B Main To B Default Hothands
data.description: This Hothands lineup is useful for stopping enemy players from defusing the Spike on B Default.

data.title: B Tunnel to B Main Hot Hands
data.description: This is a good Hot Hands to burn enemies pushing onto B Site and to also delay a push onto B Site by blocking the entrance in flames.

data.title: A Pyramid to A Cave Curveball
data.description: This is a good Curveball to blind enemies pushing onto A Site or to blind enemies in A Cave to delay a push or to swing onto.

data.title: Simple A Site Execute Blaze + Curveball
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective way to use your Blaze and Curveball when executing onto A Site.

data.title: B Tower Post Plant Setup Utility Usage
data.description: Here's a simple way to make good use of your Hot Hands, and your Curve Ball when delaying enemy players from defusing the Spike from B Tower.

data.title: A Door Curveball Setup to Play off of Teammate in A Main
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective way to play off one of your teammates in A Main to contest that space and make it harder for enemy players to take space inside of A Main.

data.title: B Arcade Silent Rope Fall + Curveball Lurk
data.description: Here's a great way to contest the Attackers as they push quickly through Arcade, potentially catching you off guard if you ask a teammate to break utility used to clear out behind the Arcade Boxes.

data.title: B Generator Site Hold / Retake Curveball
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective site hold / retake Curveball that allows you to swing out of a B Generator Smoke.

data.title: A Site Full Utility Execute
data.description: Here's a great way to use your entire kit to create space for your team to push into A Site.

data.title: B Site Full Utility Execute
data.description: Here's a great way to use your entire kit to create space for your team to push into B Site.

data.title: B Site Curveball Site Hold Setups
data.description: Here are several simple, but effective Curveball setups to defend against the Attackers push into B Site.

data.title: A Link Curveball Setup for Attackers Pushing Through Art
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Curveball setup to hold the push from enemy players pushing through Art from A Link.

data.title: C Site Fire Wall Execute + Flash
data.description: Use this simple, but effective Blaze + Curveball combo to execute onto C Site with your team.

data.title: B Main Hot Hands + Curveball Execute Combo
data.description: Push into B Main with this simple Hot Hands lineup, and then after clearing out B Main, push into Site with one or both of these flash variations.

data.title: A Door Hot Hands + Curveball Execute
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective way to push through A Door into A Tree.

data.title: Aggressive C Main Curveball from C Lobby
data.description: Use this Curveball to push into C Main from C Lobby.

data.title: A Tree Curveball from A Main
data.description: Use this Curveball from A Main to flash Attackers holding angles into / from inside of A Tree on the A Tree Door.

data.title: C Main Unexpected Curveball for Mound
data.description: Use this Curveball from Mound in C Main to catch attackers pushing through that area of the map off guard. This setup might not be as effective on full buy rounds, and this is especially the case on rounds where the enemy team is not full buying and your team is (anti-eco rounds). If your team can spare it, have a second player on your team ready to break utility from the C Site arches that connect Site and Main.

data.title: Early Round B Main Curveball
data.description: Use this aggressive early round curveball in B Main to look for one or two picks in B Main, and gather valuable information inside of B Main as well.

data.title: Simple C Site Default Updraft Dash + Cloudburst Entry
data.description: Here's a simple, yet very effective Updraft Dash Entry into C Site. This has to be done while your teammates are pushing into C Site, so communicate with your team to follow up with you so that they can best play around you and capitalize off of the opportunities you create with this entry.

data.title: Updraft Dash + Cloudburst Combo for Tall Boxes on B Site
data.description: Here's a common, but effective way to entry onto B Site, and gather valuable information for your team on the front side of B.

data.title: Default Cloudburst for the A Lobby Cross
data.description: Here's a more in depth variation of the most commonly used default Cloudburst for the A Lobby Cross. If another character is able to use their utility instead of your Cloudburst, that may be a better use of your team's utility.

data.title: Early Round Cloudburst to Grab A Long Ultimate Orb
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective way to safely grab the A Long Ultimate Orb.

data.title: Early Round Mid Aggression Tailwind Setup
data.description: Here's a great early round Mid aggression Tailwind Setup.

data.title: B Site Cloudburst + Tailwind Entry from B Main
data.description: Here's a very common way to entry into B Site, that can be applied in one of many ways depending on the context of the round.

data.title: Early Round A Ramps Tailwind + Utility Combo from A Main
data.description: Here's a great way to aggressively push into A Ramps at the beginning of the round.

data.title: A Rafters Updraft Dash + Cloudburst from A Main
data.description: Here's a great way to not only clear out close angles for your team while dashing deeper into A, but also potentially catch enemy players off guard, and / or apply pressure to Heaven that can increase the odds of your team taking control of Heaven.

data.title: High Risk High Reward Early Round B Main Tailwind Setups
data.description: Here's a great way to take advantage of your Tailwind to do damage to, or get a pick on an enemy player holding an angle into B Main, or an enemy player pushing into B Main.

data.title: Early Round Mid Top Tailwind Op Angle
data.description: Here's a great way to take advantage of your Tailwind to hold an Op Angle that often catches enemy players peeking Mid Top from Ramen off guard, and then dash back to Safety after taking a Shot.

data.title: Elbow Double Updraft Blade Storm Off Angle From Behind Screens Wall
data.description: This Double Updraft off angle for Elbow from behind the A Screens wall is primarily useful for getting picks with Jett's Blade Storm knives, but can also be useful for getting information on players in A Site.

data.title: B Site Lever Dash + Cloudburst Entry from B Main
data.description: Here's a great Dash + Cloudburst Entry from B Main to B Site, that puts you in a position to Activate the B Site Lever, give valuable information to your team as you dash into the Site, and then clear out Site with your team from that position.

data.title: A Site Dash + Cloudburst Entry from A Main
data.description: Here's a great Dash + Cloudburst Entry from A Main for A Site.

data.title: A Generator Updraft Dash + Cloudburst Entry from A Main
data.description: Here's a great Updraft Dash + Cloudburst Entry from A Main for the top of the A Generator.

data.title: Early Round Two Player Hold for B Main
data.description: Here's a great Early Round two player Hold for B Main, that can be a great way to gain numbers advantage early in the round, while also taking space in B main.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round Two Player Dash Setup for A Lobby
data.description: Here's an Aggressive Early Round two player Dash setup for A Lobby, that can be a great way to catch enemy players off guard, and create the opportunity for you to get a couple of picks on players in A Lobby. Just be aware of players playing from anti-flash angles in A Lobby, that can usually avoid whatever utility you use to create the opportunity to Dash up through A Main to peek A Lobby.

data.title: Extra Momentum B Site To Mid Market Tailwind
data.description: This is useful for when you want to rotate to Mid Market more quickly from B Site. To do this, back all the way into the wall and follow the lineup on screen, hold updraft and forward at the same time, aim at the roof at the same angle as seen on screen, and once you've started falling from the peak of your updraft dash directly forward into the roof.

data.title: A Rafters Jump For A Main / A Site
data.description: This double jump is useful because you can gain information on A Site/A Main, and/or get picks on A Site/A Main.

data.title: B Site Blade Storm + Updraft To See Inside Of B Main
data.description: This updraft is useful for both getting information inside of B Main from B Site, and potentially getting picks - especially since you can do this twice per round.

data.title: A Screens Lurk using Viper Wall to Catch enemy Players Off Guard
data.description: If your team has a Toxic Screen that blocks enemy players' vision of the top of screens, drifting on top of Screens from Four Ten and then lurking behind your teammate's Toxic Screen after you and your team have taken control of the Site can be a great way to catch enemy players attempting to retake the site off guard.

data.title: B Main Safe Cross Cloudburst + Updraft Combo
data.description: Here's an effective way to safely get on top of the closest container to you from the Attacker Spawn spawn barrier that connects with B Main. This is typically done alongside a flash, drone, or other similar utility that can create a window of time for you to safely cross on top of the container, and then start taking space in B Main from there.

data.title: Pre-Round Drift Pathing for B Yellow + B Green
data.description: Here's a simple way to get on top of B Yellow, or B Green in the pre-round, without having to use an Updraft.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round Pipes Setup
data.description: Here's a very common aggressive early round play for A Pipes, that can fit into many different aggressive early round setups.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round Zipline to A Belt Tailwind Setup
data.description: Here's a great early round Zipline to A Belt Tailwind setup to catch players running up the A Belt ramp off guard.

data.title: Aggressive Mid Doors Cloudburst to Aggressively Push through Mid
data.description: Here's a cloudburst that you can use to block vision of enemy players holding an angle on bottom mid, allowing you and your team to aggressively push through Mid.

data.title: Aggressive A Hall Cloudburst to Push into A Switch
data.description: Here's a great way to push into A Switch from A Hall using one, or both of your cloudbursts.

data.title: A Lobby Pre-Round Updraft to Catch A Hall Players Off Guard
data.description: Here's a great way to catch Defenders off guard who are holding an angle into hall, or lurking into Hall at the beginning of the round.

data.title: Mid Cannon To Mid Nest Bladestorm
data.description: Stand on top of the pile of rubble shown in the clip and activate your Bladestorm ability. You can then double Updraft to get high enough to kill any players in Mid Top and Mid Nest. Using this at the beginning of the round will catch players off guard as they cannot hear your Updraft ability as easily from that far.

data.title: A Pyramids Pre-Round Single Updraft Off Angle
data.description: Here's the fastest way to use a single updraft to get on top of the A Pyramids in the pre-round, which allows you to hold an off angle from the top of either of the pyramids into A Cave.

data.title: Cloudburst to Counter Sentinel Utility when Flanking on Breeze
data.description: Here's a great way to lurk past Sentinel utility when flanking either A or B.

data.title: Aggressive Updraft Dash + Cloudburst into B Tower from Arcade
data.description: Here's a great way to aggressively take control of B Tower.

data.title: A Drop To Upper A Site Dash / Cloudburst Entry
data.description: Here's a great Dash / Cloudburst Entry for Upper A Site, coupled with a cloudburst for Defender spawn after you safely make it on top of Upper A Site.

data.title: A Main To Upper A Site Dash / Updraft / Cloudburst Entry
data.description: Here's a great Dash / Updraft / Cloudburst combo to entry into upper A Site from A Main.

data.title: B Site Double Updraft + Blade Storm to Peek B Bench
data.description: Here's a great way to look for picks on players in B Bench with your Blade Storm in an often unexpected way, typically toward the beginning of the round.

data.title: B Site Double Updraft + Blade Storm to Peek B Tree
data.description: Here's a great way to look for picks on players in B Tree with your Blade Storm in an often unexpected way, typically toward the beginning of the round.

data.title: Upper A Rope Double Updraft Blade Storm For Attacker Spawn
data.description: Here's a great way to catch players off guard in Attacker Spawn from A Rope.

data.title: B Site Cloudburst + Tailwind Entry
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective B Site Cloudburst + Tailwind Entry.

data.title: A Site Cloudburst + Tailwind Entry
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective A Site Cloudburst + Tailwind Entry.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round Mid Doors One Way
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective early round Aggressive Mid Doors One Way.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round A Main Off Angle
data.description: At the very beginning of the round, follow the pathing and ability usage seen on screen to look for an untradeable pick on enemy players pushing into A Main.

data.title: B Site Drift Off Angle to Challenge B Main
data.description: Without having to use any utility, you can hover on top of the tall box seen on screen to catch enemy players pushing into B Main off guard.

data.title: B Link Blade Storm Updraft Off Angle for B Site / B Main
data.description: Use your Blade Storm to take advantage of these off Updraft off angles to catch enemy players off guard as they either push through B Main into B Site, or have already pushed deeper into B Site.

data.title: Early Round C Main Double Updraft Blade Storm
data.description: Use this early round C Main Double Updraft Blade Storm off angle to catch enemy players off guard if you think there is a high enough chance of the enemy team pushing into C Main early in the round to risk both of your Updrafts.

data.title: Aggressive A Main Smokes
data.description: Use these smokes to cross, control information, and increase your options in key areas inside of A Main when either pushing into A Site - or even just conditioning over the course of the Attacking half with the A Main cross smoke.

data.title: B Site Entry Updraft + Dash Combo
data.description: Use this simple, but effective B Site Updraft + Dash Entry to open up space on Site for your team to push in and take control.

data.title: C Site Entry  Updraft + Dash
data.description: Use this simple, but effective C Site Updraft + Dash Entry to open up space on Site for your team to push in and take control.

data.title: A Top Blade Storm Updraft Off Angle
data.description: Use this Updraft Blade Storm off angle to peek enemy players inside of A Site and A Tree. This should be done when your other retake / site hold options are less likely to succeed than this, or you have some sort of advantage that supports this play, because you create risk by giving away your position by sound when you Updraft before peeking into Site and Tree.

data.title: C Site One Way Retake / Delay Cloudburst
data.description: Use these C Site one way retake / delay cloudbursts to make it more difficult for enemy players to push into C Site or Peek into C Site without either being punished or denied vision.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round B Main Tailwind + Flash
data.description: Use this aggressive early round B Main Tailwind + Flash setup to look for picks in B Main at the start of the round.

data.title: Updraft Off Angle for Attacker A Main Cross
data.description: Use this Updraft off angle to catch enemy players off guard as they cross through A Main. Be sure to prime your Tailwind at an optimal time that is worth the risk of activating the Tailwind without getting value out of it, with the goal of getting 1 pick and then getting out.

data.title: Grass Spy Cam from Grass Spawn Barrier
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Spy Cam to peek into Garage from the Grass Spawn Barrier, as well as potentially watch the flank later in the round. This makes early round aggression from the Defenders more difficult, and gives your team valuable information.

data.title: Mid Info Spy Cam Lineup from C Lobby
data.description: Use this Spy Cam to catch enemy players off guard in Garage and Mid either early in the round to check for early round aggression from the Defenders, or to check the flank later in the round.

data.title: A Push Flank Trapwire + A Lobby Cyber Cage
data.description: Use this flank Trapwire when your team is aggressively pushing toward A. Then, at the very start of the round use the Cyber Cage to allow your team to cross through A Lobby and set up to exec onto A Site. You can also use the same cage throughout the attacking half to throw the attackers off of their game.

data.title: Default Trapwires for C and A Flanks
data.description: Here are effective Default Trapwires for the C and A Flanks.

data.title: Default Trapwire + Mid Info Spy Cam
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective default Trapwire to make it much more difficult for enemy players to flank through A Lobby, alongside an effective early round info Spy Cam for Mid.

data.title: C Site Trapwire + Cyber Cage Variations with Spy Cam
data.description: Use these Trapwire + Cyber Cage variations to lock down C Site, and keep enemy players guessing where your utility is.

data.title: C Garage Trapwire with Cyber Cage + Spy Cam Setup
data.description: Here's a simple Trapwire for C Garage, alongside an early round Cyber Cage + Spy Cam setup.

data.title: Early Round A Lobby Info Spy Cam
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective early round Spy Cam for A Lobby from A Long.

data.title: Trapwire + Cyber Cage Variations for A Site
data.description: Use these Trapwire + Cyber Cage variations to lock down A Site, and keep enemy players guessing where your utility is.

data.title: B Site Trapwire + Spy Cam + Cyber Cage Site Hold + Retake Setup
data.description: Here's a simple, but very effective Site Hold + Retake setup.

data.title: Aggressive Cyber Cage to Push Through B Tower
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Cyber Cage that can be used to push through, and / or take control of B Tower.

data.title: Early Round A Main Info Spycam + A Lobby Flank Trapwire
data.description: This combination of a Spycam and Flank Trapwire makes it much harder for Defenders to flank via this part of the map while also providing you with valuable information at the start of the round + the rest of the round as needed.

data.title: B Site to B Garage Cyber Cage
data.description: This is a good cyber cage to create a one-way smoke going into B Garage.

data.title: A Heaven Defensive Spycam
data.description: Place this Spycam on the light strip in the roof of A Heaven. It gives a one-way view onto the feet of any attackers approaching A Heaven from A Ramp. This can be good for holding a push to A Heaven from Ropes.

data.title: A Main Oneway Cage
data.description: This Cyber Cage creates a oneway sightline useful for stopping attacking pushes into the A Site. To get the most out of this cage play from A Rafters and as soon as you spot a push into the A Site activate the cage and capitalise on the oneway sightline.

data.title: Passive B Main Early Info Spy Cam
data.description: Here's a simple early round info Spy Cam for B Main, that you should use primarily when playing passive on the side of B Main.

data.title: Tiles to Cat Early Round info Spy Cam
data.description: Here is a great Spy Cam for gaining early information on whether or not enemy players are peeking into Mid from the Cat entrance into Tree, or crossing from Tree into the Cat Cubby.

data.title: Passive Trapwires for B Main and A Main
data.description: Here are two of the most reliable Traps that you can place when playing a passive Cypher setup, or a default with your team where you aren't sure where your team will end up.

data.title: Passive A Main Early Info Spy Cam
data.description: Here's a simple early round info Spy Cam for A Main, that you should use primarily when playing passive on the side of A Main.

data.title: Full Utility B Site Hold from Defender Spawn
data.description: Here is a simple, yet very reliable full utility Setup for B Site. Be sure to take advantage of the variations of the Trapwires here. Also, this is one of the most reliable setups, but that doesn't mean you should over-rely on it. Be sure to throw in other setups, or variations of this setup that combine other setups with this one.

data.title: Simple B Site Hold + Early B Main Info Setup
data.description: The Spy Cam in this setup is great for gathering early information in and close outside of B Main. This coupled with the rest of this simple setup forces enemy players to interact with your utility if they want to enter Site, even if the Cam is broken.

data.title: Full Utility A Site Setup
data.description: Here's a simple full utility setup that gives you several options for how you can respond to enemy players pushing into A Site.

data.title: Full Utility Back B Site Hold Setup
data.description: Here's a simple full utility setup that allows you a decent amount of flexibility in how you can play on B Site.

data.title: Passive A Tree + A Site Full Utility Setup
data.description: Here's a simple full utility setup that allows you to passively hold Tree, and also respond to enemy players as they push into A Site.

data.title: Ascent B Main Oneway Cage
data.description: An easy lineup for the a one way smoke on B Main. Also blocks LOS from most of the door to B Main

data.title: A Site Entrance Hidden Trapwire
data.description: This trapwire is placed on the inside of the wall making it much harder for the attacking team to destroy.

data.title: Front Right A Site Exec Spy Cam
data.description: This is a great Spy Cam variation to check many of the commonly held angles on A Site when executing onto Site.

data.title: A Site Exec Generator Spy Cam
data.description: Use this Cypher Spy Cam when pushing into A Site through lower Pipes with your team.

data.title: B Exec Flank Trapwire
data.description: Here's a simple B execute Trapwire for the B Flank.

data.title: Full Utility A Site Setup
data.description: Here's a straightforward and effective full utility setup for A Site.

data.title: B Site / B Yellow Trapwire Variations
data.description: Use these Trapwire Variations for the front of B Site and B Yellow to catch enemy players off guard and keep them guessing where your utility is when you are playing B Site.

data.title: Unexpected Passive B Main Spy Cam
data.description: Use this setup to catch enemy players off guard as they attempt to push outside of B Main into B Site.

data.title: Defender Spawn Spy Cam for Mid + Aggressive Mid Trapwire
data.description: Use this Spy Cam to keep an eye on the Mid Attacker cross throughout the course of the round. Also feel free to combo this with the Trapwire seen on screen to make it more difficult for enemy players to push through Mid.

data.title: B Tube Trapwire + Spawn Spy Cam Combo for Mid
data.description: Use this Trapwire to make it so that enemy players trying to lurk through Tube are forced to use utility, or alert you to their location by breaking the Trapwire, if they want to enter kitchen.

data.title: Defender Spawn Point Spycam
data.description: This is a good camera to see into middle from spawn.

data.title: B Kitchen to Mid Blue Spycam
data.description: This is a good spycam to defend B Orange and also get information of enemies playing around Mid Blue.

data.title: Cannon to Mid Window Spycam
data.description: A good early round Spycam to see into Mid Window and get a good vantage point of any potential Ops early into the round.

data.title: A Lobby to Hall Spycam
data.description: A good early round Spycam to see enemies peeking Hall.

data.title: A Site to Mid Doors Cyber Cage
data.description: A good one-way Cyber Cage to get an advantage on people pushing up the Mid Doors.

data.title: A Site Mid Doors Spycam
data.description: A good Spycam to see both angles into A Site.

data.title: B Main One-Way Cyber Cage Held From B Tunnel
data.description: This is an easy to set up Cyber Cage one-way lineup for B Main that is meant to be held from B Tunnel.

data.title: Aggressive B Arcade Spy Cam
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Spy Cam for B Arcade from B Bench.

data.title: B Site Execute Spy Cam
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Spy Cam for B Site from B Main.

data.title: A Main Spawn Barrier Spy Cam
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Spy Cam that allows you to safely spot and tag enemy players peeking out of A Main toward the start of the round, while also leaving a Spy Cam that can be used to watch the flank.
