data.title: Mid Courtyard to Mid Bottom Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to push Mid and clear close angles along with blinding anyone peaking from B Market.

data.title: B Main to B Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to push into B Site and clear angles towards B Switch.

data.title: B Lobby to B Main Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to help your team push into B Main from B Lobby.

data.title: A Rafter to A Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to peak A Rafter with and secure kills on anyone peaking A Site Archway.

data.title: A Site to A Main Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to stop an A Main push from A Switch.

data.title: A Rafter to A Under Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind and peak your enemies hiding in A Under during a retake.

data.title: A Tree to Mid Catwalk Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind anyone pushing up Mid Catwalk allowing you to get information and back off or peak and get a kill.

data.title: A Wine to A Main Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind anyone pushing A Main from A Wine allowing you to peak and get a kill or early valuable information.

data.title: Defender Spawn to B Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to retake B Site with from Defender Spawn.

data.title: Defender Spawn to Mid Market Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind people pushing up middle or people peaking defender spawn rotation from market.

data.title: B Market to Mid Courtyard Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind Mid Courtyard and get allow yourself to swing and get a pick or gather information.

data.title: B Market to B Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer for blinding people pushing B Main doorway and allowing you to swing and get a pick or get information.

data.title: B Site to B Main Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to stop a b main push by getting information or having a teammate playing off your leer.

data.title: B Tube to B Kitchen Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind your opponent in B Kitchen.

data.title: A Nest to A Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to peak out A Nest and hold A Site for your team to push or to get a quick pick.

data.title: B Window to B Snowpile Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind B Snowpile from B Kitchen window.

data.title: B Snowpile to B Orange Leer
data.description: This is a good leer from B Snowpile to blind enemies in B Orange.

data.title: B Kitchen to Mid Blue Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to assist your teammates in middle.

data.title: B Kitchen to B Tube Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to punish players peeking B Kitchen from B Tube.

data.title: Mid Boiler to Mid Blue Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to peak out from mid boiler and get information on your opponents or get a quick pick if they are peaking.

data.title: B Orange to Mid Blue Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to peak out middle and get information on your enemies or a quick pick if they are peaking.

data.title: B Green to B Garage Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to peak right as soon as the boundaries go down and get a quick pick or valuable information on your opponents.

data.title: B Main to B Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind enemies and push onto B Site.

data.title: B Window Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to peek B Window and blind your enemies in the process

data.title: Mid Pillar Leer
data.description: This is a good leer for taking Mid Pillar and pushing up Top Mid.

data.title: A Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to push onto A Site and clear angles.

data.title: A Hall to A Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer for A Site from A Hall to help your teammates push onto A Site.

data.title: B Wall to B Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer for B Site.

data.title: Top Mid to Bottom Mid Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to blind enemies pushing Bottom Mid.

data.title: Mid Wooden Doors to Bottom Mid Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to flash out to Mid Bottom.

data.title: A Pyramid to A Site Leer
data.description: This is a good leer to stop enemies from pushing onto A Site from A Main.

data.title: A Site Angle Exec Leer from A Main
data.description: Here's a simple Leer to break many of the commonly held angles on A Site, and help your team to push out into the Site. This is especially useful when flashing out of a smoke placed on the A Main chokepoint.

data.title: A Main Leer for Op and Doors Angles
data.description: Here's a simple Leer to break the common early round A Main Op angle, and the doors angle.

data.title: Early Round Leer to Contest A Main
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Leer that can give away key information on whether or not enemy players are trying to take space in A Main, and make it easier for you and your team to contest that space.

data.title: B Generator Site Hold Leer
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Leer to flash out of B Generator / Defender spawn, typically when B Generator is smoked off, as the enemy players are pushing through key chokepoints into B.

data.title: B Site Site Hold Leer from B Canteen
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Leer to flash out of B Canteen, typically when Canteen is smoked off, as the enemy players are pushing through key chokepoints into B.

data.title: B Ramp Leer
data.description: A good Leer to approach this angle though be wary of enemies holding from Back B Site as this Leer will not affect the common Operator angle.

data.title: Mid Doors Leer
data.description: A good Leer to advance through and take control of Mid Doors.

data.title: A Main to A Site Leer
data.description: This is a good Leer to throw when taking control of A Main to peek the front A Site angle.

data.title: A Dugout to A Site Leer
data.description: This is a good Leer from A Dugout to peek and attack enemies pushing onto A Site from A Main.

data.title: B Tower to B Site Leer
data.description: This is a good Leer to use when retaking B Site or to defend against a B Site push.

data.title: Early Round C Main Leer
data.description: Use this aggressive Leer either to make it more difficult for enemy players to take space in C Main at the beginning of the round, or to push into C Main at any stage of the round.

data.title: A Main Angle Breaking Leer
data.description: Use this Leer from B Main to break many of the commonly held angles inside of B Site.

data.title: Angle Breaking B Site Leer from B Main
data.description: Use this Leer from B Main to break many of the commonly held angles inside of B Site.

data.title: B Site Hold / Retake Leer
data.description: Use this Leer to either delay the Attacker's push into B Site or retake later in the round. This Leer is ideal for breaking angles in B Main and A Link.

data.title: Early Round A Main Leer to Contest Space
data.description: Use this early round Leer to contest space in A Main. Coordinate with the rest of your team to combo their utility with yours to successfully take space in / contest the Attackers efforts to take space in A Main.

data.title: Unexpected C Main Leer from C Mound
data.description: Use this unexpected C Main Leer to catch Attackers off guard from C Mound.

data.title: Early Round Haystack Turret
data.description: Place this Turret at the start of the round to spot for any Mid aggression.

data.title: Safe Spawn Turret For Garage
data.description: This is a good start round Turret to use to punish any aggressive Defender for overextending. This spots all aggressive pushes, except for Window.

data.title: Nanoswarm Lineup For C Site Spawn
data.description: Use this molly lineup to punish Defenders from rotating from C Link to C Site, and flushes anyone sitting in the spawn smoke during your C execute.

data.title: Sewers Lockdown For A Site
data.description: Here's a strong Lockdown placement that allows for an easy A Site take. There will be two gaps though when using this ult, the right side of Heaven and Hell. Nonetheless, it effectively isolates the Defenders.

data.title: A Site Turret + Flank Alarmbot
data.description: A good Turret to place to watch both Defender Spawn entrance and A Heaven window with an added Alarmbot to watch flank.

data.title: Back A Site Nanoswarm Grenades
data.description: A good set of Nanoswarm grenades to push Defenders out from behind A Site.

data.title: Grass to Garage Doors Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for clearing out players playing directly in the corner directly left of the Garage Doors as you come into Garage.

data.title: A Garden To Front B Site Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful post plant, for stopping players from defusing the Spike on the front of B Site.

data.title: C Long To Left Side of C Default Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for stopping players from defusing the Spike on the left side of C Default.

data.title: A Long To A Tower Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for stopping players from peeking from A Tower while your teammates are pushing into A Site.

data.title: A Garden Turret For Attacker Side Spawn
data.description: This turret lineup is useful for alerting you of players flanking from Mid Courtyard, A Lobby, and C Lobby.

data.title: Aggressive Garage Turret
data.description: Make sure to place your molly at the entrance of Garage when the barrier drops for a strong set piece, which lets you fight for Garage more convincingly.

data.title: Standard C Site Turret Setup
data.description: This combination of Killjoy utility focuses on retaking B, while the goal is to contest for Garage/C Site. This setup allows for more freedom to rotate, as it covers 3 major parts of the map. Alternatively, you can place your Alarmbot in Garage with your Mollies spread out on the map.

data.title: C Site Retake Lockdown
data.description: Use this setup to retake the C Site with your Lockdown. It clears all of site, except for back Platform, and pushes Attackers back into deep C Long.

data.title: B Site Turret + Garage Alarmbot
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective Killjoy setup to cover Mid on Haven.

data.title: A Link Lockdown For A Site
data.description: This lockdown setup is useful for clearing out the entirety of A Site.

data.title: C Link To Left C Default Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for stopping players from peeking you from the right side of Default on C Site, or potentially delaying  players from planting the spike in that area.

data.title: A Link To Graffiti Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for clearing players in the corner seen in the second POV.

data.title: A Link To Front Side Of A Default Nanoswarm
data.description: This nanoswarm lineup is useful for potentially stopping players from planting the Spike on the front side of Default on A Site, and even if it doesn't it has the potential to do some serious damage and open up some opportunities for your teammates to retake A Site.

data.title: Early Round Mid Turret from Market
data.description: Here's an easy combination of Killjoy's utility that allows for easier mid control.

data.title: Nanoswarm Lineup for B Site Pillar
data.description: Here's a strong molly lineup to flush Defenders out into the open, while executing the B Site. This lineup is much more effective when coordinating a split on the B Site.

data.title: B Main Turret Control
data.description: Use this simple turret to allow for easier control of B Main.

data.title: A Main Lockdown for Attacker
data.description: Here's a combination of Killjoy's utility that enables Lockdown to clear all of A Site, and a good portion of A Heaven. The turret will spot your flank and attack any Defenders from being aggressive.

data.title: Start Round A Main Turret
data.description: A simple turret that punishes Defenders for overextending.

data.title: Mid Mail To B Tower Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for pushing players out from behind the box to the right of the Mid Mail entrance into B Tower.

data.title: Lower A Sewers Alarmbot
data.description: This Alarmbot setup is useful for alerting you of players lurking in, or flanking through through A Sewers.

data.title: A Lobby To Back A Site Post Plant Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for stopping players from defusing the spike behind the A Site Box. Make sure to activate the Nanoswarm as soon as possible to ensure it doesn't get destroyed as soon as it hits the ground.

data.title: A Lobby To Back Left Inner A Site Corner Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for stopping players from defusing the spike on the Back Left corner of inner A Site. Make sure to activate the Nanoswarm as soon as possible to ensure it doesn't get destroyed as soon as it hits the ground.

data.title: A Lobby to A Site Default Post Plant Nanoswarm
data.description: This nanoswarm lineup is useful for stopping players from defusing the spike on the back side of A Site, as well as making it more diffiicult to hold that area of the site, since the nanoswarm covers such a large amount of a commonly played area, which can assist your team in getting picks on players affected by the nanoswarm.

data.title: B Heaven Rafters Turret Setup
data.description: Use this powerful Killjoy turret in combination with your teammate's utility to contest for control of B Heaven.

data.title: Start Round Turret for B Main and B Heaven
data.description: An effective standard Killjoy setup that covers both B Main and B Heaven.

data.title: A Site Turret + Molly Combo for Defender
data.description: Here's a strong Killjoy setup that allows you to anchor on the A Site.

data.title: A Site Retake + A Heaven Control
data.description: Use this strong setup to prevent Attackers from rushing A Site successfully, while contesting for A Heaven Control.

data.title: Nanoswarm Setup For Under B Tower Zipline
data.description: This Nanoswarm setup is useful for breaking up the attacker's push into B Site from the B Tower Zipline, and potentially opening up opportunities to secure picks on players who have come down the B Tower Zipline.

data.title: A Tower To A Main Nanoswarm
data.description: This Nanoswarm lineup is useful for breaking up the Attacker's push out of A Main onto A Site, or delaying it entirely.

data.title: Early Round Tiles Turret
data.description: Place this Turret on top of the left Tiles wall to ensure any information of an aggressive push at Mid. This Turret also spots deep Top Mid, in between Defenders Spawn and Market.

data.title: Ascent B Site Lockdown
data.description: A strong combination of Killjoy's Lockdown and Turret allow for an easier take on the B Site. The ultimate ability clears all of site, except for the back right.

data.title: Ascent A Main Lockdown
data.description: A strong combination of Killjoy's Lockdown and Turret allow for an easier take on the A Site. The ultimate ability clears all of tree, but the only gaps from this ultimate is both the right side of of Heaven and Hell.

data.title: Start Round Turret For A Main
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective Turret to use when looking to take A Main control.

data.title: Simple Mid Top Turret
data.description: A good Turret to plop down as soon as the barrier drops to see if anyone is pushing Mid.

data.title: B Site Post Plant Setup
data.description: A good setup for B Site that can help prevent Defenders from retaking as easily.

data.title: Simple B Main Flank Turret
data.description: A good Turret to watch your flank and aggressors pushing B Main.

data.title: A Site Aggressive Nanoswarm & Turret
data.description: A good Nanoswarm and Turret combo that helps with your A Site execute while also having an Alarmbot watching your flank.

data.title: B Lobby To B Site Default Post Plant Nanoswarm
data.description: This nanoswarm is perfect for playing a post plant for default, throw it early and wait for a defusal sound prior to activating. Make sure to push up into B main after to insure the defusal sound is heard.

data.title: B Main To Market Nanoswarm
data.description: This nanoswarm line up is quick and easy to get someone completely off of the market door angle. Combine this with a smoke as you come out B main towards site as they will be able to see you as you cross into lane without it!

data.title: Front And Left Side Generator Post Plant Nanoswarm
data.description: This nanoswarm line up is perfect for an afterplant situation for generators, throw it prior to the defending side getting back into site. Then wait for the defusal sound before activating for an easy round win.

data.title: Under Rafters To Rafters Hidden Nanoswarm
data.description: This nanoswarm will do damage to anyone in heaven without them being able to see its position. Allowing you to deny a good amount of time before the defending side can get back into site, while you stay completely safe.

data.title: Aggressive Turret For Mid Control
data.description: This is an aggressive placement of utility that allows you to shift off of the B Site and fight for Mid with an extra crossfire. It is recommended to use this set up when fighting with a teammate.

data.title: Full Utility B Site Hold
data.description: Use this powerful setup to anchor the B Site with relative ease, as you have a kill set up for Lane and a Turret that spots for information.

data.title: Tree Lockdown Retake Setup
data.description: Here's an extremely strong retake setup which uses your Lockdown. The combination of your Alarmbot and Mollies make it very tough for Attackers to try and harass the retake ultimate.

data.title: Alarmbot For Ascent A Door
data.description: Use this strong kill set up to punish Attackers for trying to close the door, or players attacking the site from Tree.

data.title: A Link Default Setup
data.description: A good setup to detect and protect against enemy players pushing toward A Link.

data.title: B Main Default Setup
data.description: A good setup to keep sightlines into B Main while also keeping tabs on Mid Pizza.

data.title: B Site Default Setup
data.description: A good B Site setup that also allows you to watch Mid Pizza.

data.title: A Site + A Link Default Setup
data.description: A good setup that allows you to keep tabs on Mid Pizza while watching both A Main and A Link.

data.title: Defender Spawn to B Main Turret
data.description: This turret is great to play off of when attempting to hold B Main, playing inside of Mid Market and waiting for your turret to get contact prior to peeking is an easy way to shut down B executes.

data.title: B Site Molly Lineup for Post Plant
data.description: Use this safe molly lineup for post plant to secure the round win from B Long to B Site.

data.title: Nanoswarm Lineup for B Site Execute
data.description: Here's an effective molly lineup to flush defenders out in the middle of site into the open.

data.title: B Site Lockdown for Attacker
data.description: A strong combination of Killjoy's Alarmbot and Lockdown to secure B Site while watching flank simultaneously.

data.title: A Site Lockdown for Attacker
data.description: A strong combination of Killjoy's Lockdown and Turret to secure A Site while watching flank simultaneously.

data.title: A Screens Alarmbot + A Site Post Plant
data.description: A good Alarmbot to watch enemies pushing through A Screens as-well as a good setup for a post plant for on-top of A Site.

data.title: B Site Post Plant Setup
data.description: A good setup to watch your flank and also apply pressure to the Defenders when they are trying to retake.

data.title: Attacker Spawn Turret For B Flank
data.description: This is a fairly common, but effective Turret for the B Flank.

data.title: A Belt Off Angle Turret For A Flank
data.description: This is a great Turret to watch the A Flank. It is positioned at an off angle so it might be more likely to catch a player off guard. However, if you are playing the right side of A Belt, the Turret will not alert you to players who use utility to cross to the right entrance into A Site before those players can see into A Belt.

data.title: Attacker Spawn Turret For Under B Tube / B Flank / A Flank
data.description: This is a great all around Turret that watches under B Tube, the B Flank, and the A Flank.

data.title: Early Round Mid Blue To Mid Boiler Nanoswarm
data.description: This lineup is useful at the very beginning of the round to help your teammates take some space in Mid. However, enemy players could get very aggressive or look for information that can help them stop you from taking that space in mid, if you are not careful / do not work well with your teammates to set this up.

data.title: Back Left A Belt To A Site Default Post-Plant Nanoswarm
data.description: This is useful for delaying the Spike defuse and doing damage to players on the Spike when it is planted on A Site Default.

data.title: Mid Boiler Turret Setup
data.description: Here's a variation of a standard Killjoy setup at mid. This setup allows your mid player to rotate more freely, as the Alarmbot and Turret cover any Attacker lurks effectively.

data.title: Retake B Mid Setup
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective Killjoy setup that counters mid lurks. This setup allows you to stall the bomb plant for B Site and lets you and your team rotate fast.

data.title: Full Utility B Site Setup for Defender
data.description: Use this strong Killjoy setup to harass Attackers with all of your utility. Your turret allows you to focus on B Long with a teammate, as it watches your mid lurk.

data.title: Full Utility A Site Setup for Defender
data.description: Use this strong Killjoy setup to lock the A Site down with all of your utility. Adjust your turret according to the enemy team Viper, as it should still poke through her wall, allowing you to play a strong crossfire with you and your utility.

data.title: A Site Default Setup
data.description: A good setup for A Site with 3 Turret variations.

data.title: B Site Aggressive Turret + B Orange Turret
data.description: A good Turret to place aggressively and a good Turret to place to watch under Tube. Additionally, we have 3 potential Nanoswarm grenades and a good spot to place your Alarmbot.

data.title: B Site + B Kitchen Default Setup
data.description: A good setup that allows you to watch B Kitchen while also having utility on B Site for when enemies push toward planting.

data.title: Aggressive Two Person Setup For A Site
data.description: This is a great two person setup for A Site to do when you want to try to get picks on enemy players pushing into A Site. Eco rounds, or rounds where a duelist on your team wants to get Aggressive on A Site are common examples of situations you might use this setup.

data.title: Right A Site To A Nest Nanoswarm
data.description: This lineup is useful both for stopping the Attackers from taking control of A Site, and for stopping the Attackers from peeking from A Tower post-plant.

data.title: Right A Pyramid Post Plant Nanoswarm
data.description: This is a useful post plant Nanoswarm for the corner on the far right side of the A Pyramids on the side of A Cave.

data.title: B Site Default Post Plant Nanoswarm
data.description: This is a simple, but useful post plant Nanoswarm lineup from just outside of Mid Cannon near the B Window Stairs.

data.title: A Lobby Flank Turret
data.description: This is a simple, but useful Turret to watch the A Lobby Flank.

data.title: B Site Turret For B Tunnel / B Main
data.description: This is a simple, but effective Turret that watches both B Tunnel and B Main.

data.title: Full Utility Setup For B Main Choke Point
data.description: This is a great full utility setup to keep a tight hold on the B Main Chokepoint. This setup can be played from B Tunnel or B Back.

data.title: B Site Wall Turret
data.description: This is a simple, but useful Turret that watches B Main and B Tunnel from an awkward angle for players coming out of B Main. Make sure to angle the turret so that it can see every angle in B Back though, since this turret can still be useful once the Attacker's have taken Site after a viper wall, or any other smokes / utility no longer give the Attackers cover on Site.

data.title: Rafters Nanoswarm For Sands Push
data.description: Use this lineup to isolate the Defenders when taking Sands, as they cannot come out of the smoke unpunished to help their teammates.

data.title: Safe Spawn Turret
data.description: Here's a strong Turret to use to spot for any Defender aggression coming from both mains. Place it during the planning phase.

data.title: A Site Post Plant Lineup
data.description: Position your crosshair at the top of the building shown in this video, and jump throw for a successful post plant molly.

data.title: Arcade Turret For Information
data.description: Place this Turret during planning phase to gain information of any aggressive pushes from Arcade or Dish. Positioning close to the zip allows for an easy escape, while simultaneously obtaining information of a potential crunch.

data.title: B Site Post Plant Nanoswarms For Front / Back B Site Boxes
data.description: Here are two great post plant lineups for the front and back side of the boxes in the spike plant area of B Site.

data.title: Retake Lockdown / Nanoswarm Combo For B Site
data.description: This is a great Lockdown / Nanoswarm Combo for B Site. This Lockdown used alongside a Nanoswarm for the corner in A Tower that is not effected by the Lockdown can potentially force players to have decide between being picked off by a Nanoswarm, and being detained by the Lockdown to escape the Nanoswarm.

data.title: A Main Lockdown Placement For A Site / A Drop
data.description: This is a great Lockdown for A Site / A Drop. This Lockdown used alongside default Smokes can create a strong opportunity for you and your teammates to push into A Site. If you and your team coordinate the timing of using this Lockdown - you could potentially pinch players who have to rotate out of inner A drop into A Dish.

data.title: A Drop Lockdown Placement For All Of A Site
data.description: This is a great Lockdown for all of A Site. This Lockdown used alongside default Smokes can create a strong opportunity for you and your teammates to push into A Site. If you and your team coordinate the timing of using this Lockdown - you could potentially pinch players who have to rotate out of inner A Site into A Main.

data.title: B Site Corner Plant Post Plant Nanoswarm From B Arcade
data.description: This is a great post plant Nanoswarm lineup from B Arcade.

data.title: Aggressive Turret For Dish Control
data.description: Use this setup to contest for Dish/Drop, while stalling A Main. If uncontested and you have ult, you could retake the A Site from Drop.

data.title: Off Site Sands Turret
data.description: Use this setup to isolate Attackers when executing the A Site. This Turret allows you to fight Sands with an extra crossfire, the Mollies stall for your team's rotations, and the Alarmbot gains information of a potential lurker.

data.title: Start Round Alarmbot For Arcade
data.description: Isolate Attacker's executes by using this setup. Use your Mollies to stall B Main Attackers and focus your resources towards Arcade. Since your Alarmbot and Turret prevents any lurks from occurring on the B Site, this allows for your teammate to have more freedom to rotate and have an easier time contesting Arcade with you.

data.title: Standard Turret Setup To Spot Arcade
data.description: Here's a good, standard setup to use to cover both lanes that approach the B Site.

data.title: Full Utility Setup For A Main / A Drop
data.description: This is a great Full Utility Setup to do damage to players pushing through A Main into A Site, that delays players from approaching the A Main / A Site chokepoint - while also keeping somewhat of a hold on A Drop / A Dish.

data.title: Simple Counter To B Tunnel Lockdown
data.description: Here's a simple way to counter a Lockdown placed in a vulnerable position in B Tunnel.

data.title: Retake Lockdown / Nanoswarm Combo For B Site
data.description: This is a great Lockdown / Nanoswarm Combo for B Site. This Lockdown used alongside a Nanoswarm for the corner in A Tower that is not effected by the Lockdown can potentially force players to have decide between being picked off by a Nanoswarm, and being detained by the Lockdown to escape the Nanoswarm.

data.title: B Generator Turret For B Main / B Arcade
data.description: This B Generator Turret will react to players pushing up B Main, as well as players pushing through B Arcade.

data.title: Full Utility Setup For A Main / A Site Choke Point
data.description: This is a great Full Utility Setup for the A Main / A Site Chokepoint that makes it very difficult for players to push into A Site from A Main, doing a lot of damage to players attempting to push into A Site in the process - or at least buying some time for your team to rotate to A to help defend A. One added benefit of this setup is that the Turret will react to players pushing out of A Main, players jumping down from A Drop, and players who have pushed far enough through A Ropes.

data.title: Simple A Site Stairs Turret For A Main / A Drop / A Ropes
data.description: This Turret will react to players pushing out of A Main onto A Site, players jumping down from A Drop, and players who have pushed far enough through A Ropes into A Site.

data.title: Early Round Shop Turret For Mid
data.description: Here's a strong combination of utility that spots your B flank and any aggressive pushes from Mid.

data.title: Early Round Turret For Mid
data.description: Place this Turret at the start of the round to punish Defenders from aggressively peeking Mid.

data.title: Nanoswarm Lineup From Shop to Link
data.description: Here's a solid molly lineup that allows you to contest for Link, as it isolates your fight with the B Site player.

data.title: Nanoswarm Back A Site Lineup
data.description: Throw this molly to allow for an easier execute on the A Site, it flushes any Defender playing that back site position out.

data.title: Turret + Swarm Grenade B Site Execute and Post Plant
data.description: This Execute and Post Plant setup allows you to help your team to get out onto B Site, while playing close enough to your Turret to allow it to watch the flank.

data.title: B Site Lockdown Execute + Molly Setup
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective way to Execute onto B Site using a Lockdown, that also creates the opportunity for you to pick off enemies who try to avoid the Lockdown in back B Site.

data.title: A Site Full Utility Lockdown Execute
data.description: Here's an aggressive full utility Lockdown Execute for A Site.

data.title: Standard B Site / Link Setup
data.description: Here's a strong setup to play off of the B Site, only using your Turret to confirm information. You are able to listen to footsteps and utility from the bottom of Link, so it'll be easy to prepare yourself for their B Site execute. It is recommended to fight for Link control with a teammate.

data.title: Retake Lockdown For B Site + B Long
data.description: Use this setup to contest Link control with a teammate to ensure your Lockdown. There are no gaps to it, so be wary of Attackers seeking to destroy your ult.

data.title: Retake Lockdown For A Main
data.description: Use this setup to contest for Art/Mid to set up your Lockdown to retake the A Site. This ultimate will push Attackers to either take Art or Spawn, or flush them all the way out back towards their own Spawn.

data.title: Standard Alarmbot Setup For Art
data.description: Here's a solid, standard setup that lets you play a crossfire with your turret from A Site or between A Site and Art. If you do play on the site, it covers both A Main Attackers and Art ones.

data.title: Standard Turret Setup For Art
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective setup that allows you to play between the A Site and Art.

data.title: Full Utility A Site + Art Setup
data.description: This full utility setup for A Site and Art allows you to delay enemies from planting the spike on site, while also giving you information on where enemies are pushing through on A side of the map.

data.title: Art + Mid Doors Full Utility Hold
data.description: Here's a full utility setup that allows you to primarily hold Art, while leaving utility at Mid Doors to let your team know if enemies push through Doors.

data.title: B Tower to B Site Spike Plant Denial Swarm Grenade Lineup
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective spike plant denial swarm grenade lineup for behind the tall box on B Site from B Tower.

data.title: Full Utility C Site Execute + Post Plant Site Hold
data.description: This is a straightforward, and very effective full utility C Site Execute + post plant Site hold. Only place the Turret after your team has taken a considerable amount of control of C Main.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round C Main Turret + Full Utility Post Plant
data.description: Use this turret early in the round to attempt to take space in C Main, if your team successfully takes control of C, then use the rest of this setup in the post plant.

data.title: A Execute Turret + Alarm Bot
data.description: Use this Turret + Alarm Bot setup when pushing onto A with your team.

data.title: B Main Lurk Turret Setup when Team is Pushing A
data.description: Use this Turret when your team is pushing toward A, if you want to lurk into B Main.

data.title: Early Round A Main Turret + Full Utility A and B Setup
data.description: Place this Turret in A Main at the start of the round to spot the Attackers if they peek into A Main from A Lobby.

data.title: A Main + A Tree Full Utility Delay Setup
data.description: Here's a full utility delay setup for A Main and A Tree. Use this setup to allow your teammates time to rotate to A Site to help defend it, and to break up the attackers push into Site to make it easier for you to look for picks on enemy players as they push in.

data.title: Quick C Long To Right Side C Site Guiding Light
data.description: This is useful for supporting your teammates as they push into C Site from Garage and C Long, since you can either flash players in some of the commonly held angles on the close right side of C Site, or gather information on whether or not players are/aren't holding angles from those positions.

data.title: Safe A Garden To Mid Courtyard
data.description: This lineup allows you to gather information on Mid Courtyard and potentially inside of B Site safely, without the worry of being wallbanged by players in B Site through the right Mid Window Wall.

data.title: A Long To Close Right A Site Guiding Light
data.description: This is useful for clearing out the close right angle that has to be cleared inside of A Site, when pushing from A Long into A Site. You can also let it go a bit further and flash players on the angle on opposite far Left corner of A Site as well.

data.title: C Long Cubby Guiding Light To Flash Right Side C Site
data.description: This is useful for supporting your teammates push into C Site from C Long, and Garage.

data.title: Grass Support/Info Flash Into Garage
data.description: This is primarily useful for gathering information on the inside of Garage, or supporting your teammates push inside. Make sure your team has control of Grass, and that players can't easily lurk into Mid Courtyard and pick you off that way.

data.title: A Link To Front B Site Guiding Light
data.description: This is primarily useful for breaking up the Attacker's push into B Site, gathering information on the front side of B Site, and supporting your teammates as they retake control of the Site.

data.title: C Link To Front B Site Guiding Light
data.description: This is primarily useful for breaking up the Attacker's push into B Site, gathering information on the front side of B Site, and supporting your teammates as they retake control of the Site.

data.title: A Ramps Info / Aggressive Trailblazer from A Lobby
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Trailblazer that can be used to clear out A Ramps either to gather information on Ramps, or assist your team in pushing up Ramps. This is typically used toward the beginning of the round, but can be used at later stages of the round.

data.title: Mid Aggression / Info Gathering Trailblazer
data.description: Using a Trailblazer to clear out whatever your team needs cleared out the most that is connected with mid, just make sure that you pick the right spot to use the Trailblazer from, since using one makes you a target for the enemy team.

data.title: Early Round B Tower / B Main Trailblazers for Mid / B Lobby
data.description: These two Trailblazers are great for gathering information on enemy players in Mid, Ramen, and B Lobby. As the Defending half progresses, you should get a feel for which one to use based on how the Attackers play in this general area of the map.

data.title: Mid Vent Information Flash from A Tower
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective way to gather information on whether or not enemy players are pushing through Mid Vent. Just make sure that you are aware of the timing of enemy players pushing through that area of the map so that you don't get picked off by a player closer than you had previously thought.

data.title: Early Round A Ramp Trailblazer for A Lobby
data.description: Here's a great way to gather information on A Main and A Lobby toward the beginning of the round from A Ramps. If you spot a high mobility Duelist getting ready to push up Ramps, immediately leave the view of the trailblazer and either back up or fight the Duelist.

data.title: How to Split A Site With Trailblazer at Tree
data.description: Follow this Trailblazer pathing to prevent Defenders playing Tree from disrupting your A Site split.

data.title: B Site Guiding Light Set Flashes
data.description: Combo your utility to prevent Defenders from obtaining free picks towards B Main with these execute flashes.

data.title: Guiding Light To Open Up Mid Courtyard Push Into Mid Bottom
data.description: This is useful for flashing players holding many of the commonly held angles on the Defender side of Mid, if you have the full support of your team.

data.title: Pizza/Outer Mid Market Guiding Light To Defender Spawn
data.description: This is useful for flashing players holding most of the commonly held angles on the Defender Side of Mid, as well as in and around the Defender Side Spawn. Be sure to do this with the help of your team and not over commit though, since this is counter-able by the Defenders if done carelessly.

data.title: B Main Entrance Into B Site Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking for utility and players inside or close outside of B Main on B Site.

data.title: Guiding Light For A Rafters/A Site From A Main
data.description: This is mainly useful for flashing a player on rafters from an unexpected angle, but is also useful for getting information on A Site, depending on how far you guide the guiding light above the wall dividing A Site and A Main.

data.title: Trailblazer For A Main Entrance Into A Site
data.description: This is useful for checking for traps and other utility around the A Main entrance into A Site, as well as potentially gathering some information on the location of players in Site.

data.title: Guiding Light Cat Peek From Tree
data.description: Here's a universally strong flash lineup you can use for info on Attackers at Mid, or to set up a play. You can set for a solo play, or coordinate one with your teammates at Bottom Mid.

data.title: B Main Peek With Guiding Light
data.description: Use this flash lineup to peek B Main effectively, you can also use this to support teammates from sitting directly under the window as well.

data.title: Guiding Light To Retake A Site From A Rafters
data.description: This is useful for both flashing players on A Site, and getting information on players on A Site. This can be useful whether you flash someone or not, because you are either forcing enemy players to not peek, or you are getting information on players and potentially creating an opening to get a pick on Site.

data.title: B Site To Mid Bottom Guiding Light To Flash Most Of Mid
data.description: This is useful for assisting your teammates in Mid Cubby, A Tree, Mid Market, and Mid Bottom if they are being pushed by the Attackers anywhere in Mid.

data.title: A Site To A Lobby Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking for utility and players in A Lobby and A Main.

data.title: B Site To B Lobby Entrance Into B Main Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking for utility and players around the entrance into B Main From B Lobby, and for looking for information on as much of B Lobby as you're able to without the enemy shooting your trailblazer.

data.title: Trailblazer To Retake B Site From Defender Side Spawn
data.description: This is useful for scouting out the location of players in both outer and inner B Site when retaking the Site, and if you manage to stun someone that could be very beneficial to your and your team as you push into site.

data.title: Post Plant Yellow Guiding Light
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective pop flash lineup you can use to disrupt Defenders trying to retake the site.

data.title: How to Take B Long With Trailblazer
data.description: Follow this Trailblazer pathing to enable your teammates taking B Long control. It's not important to try and bite Defenders, you may use it to leap a distance to gain information.

data.title: Mid Blue to Mid Boiler Guiding Light
data.description: This is a good guiding light to blind enemies playing Mid Boiler and allow you to peak or go under B Tube and take B Site.

data.title: A Rafter to Defender Spawn Guiding Light
data.description: This is a good guiding light to blind and swing on rotators that are rotating to A Site.

data.title: A Pipes to A Pipes Corner Trailblazer
data.description: This is a good trailblazer to concuss your enemies hiding in the corner of A Pipes towards A Site.

data.title: A Nest to A Site Guiding Light
data.description: This is a good guiding light to blind enemies peaking A Nest from A Site and allow you to swing and get a kill. This is good for getting an entry pick and gaining access to A Site.

data.title: How to Support at Mid With Trailblazer From Pallet
data.description: Follow this simple, but effective Trailblazer pathing to set up your teammates to have an advantageous fight at Mid. Make sure to match the timing with their peek, as Attackers will look to shoot your utility.

data.title: Early Round Guiding Light to Belt For Info
data.description: Here's a great start round info flash you can use, it will spot any Attacker at the A side part of the map.

data.title: Top 410 Guiding Light Peek
data.description: Use this fast and easy lineup to enable yourself an advantageous fight, your teammates will have an easier time contesting from lower angles, as the flash pops directly above 410.

data.title: Window to B Tube Guiding Light
data.description: This is a good guiding light to blind enemies peaking from under B Tube and allow you to swing and get a kill.

data.title: B Tube to Mid Blue Guiding Light
data.description: This is a good guiding light to blind enemies peaking Mid Boiler or under B Tube from Mid Blue. Swinging off your flash will guarantee you a kill if you blind them.

data.title: B Green to B Garage Guiding Light
data.description: This is a good aggressive guiding light to get a pick and fall back.

data.title: Unique A Lever Guiding Light From A Hall
data.description: This is a unique way to check for players in A Lever using a Guiding Light. Be careful to avoid textures on the wall in A Lever that the Guiding Light may get stuck on when using this though.

data.title: Mid Wood Doors Anti-Wallbang Trailblazer
data.description: If you tuck yourself into the corner to the left of the Mid Wood Doors in Mid when you go to send a Trailblazer into A Site / Mid Wood Doors, players would have to stand very close to the Mid Wood Doors at an awkward angle to wallbang you through the Doors.

data.title: Cave Side A Site To Behind A Pyramids Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking if there are players behind A Pyramids, after your teammates put smokes down on A Site. This should be used with the idea in mind that if no one is behind Pyramids your teammates will either plant the Spike more freely, or make good use of that information.

data.title: A Hall Seekers To Check A Metal Doors / Defender Side Spawn / A Bridge
data.description: This is useful for clearing out players behind A Metal Doors, and anywhere near A Site or Defender Side Spawn depending on where the closest three players on the map are.

data.title: B Elbow To B Tunnel / Mid Top Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking both B Tunnel, and Mid Top for players. You are in a vulnerable position to B Main and players pushing into B Elbow from Mid Top though while using this Trailblazer so you may need support from your teammates to safely do this.

data.title: B Hall To Close Left A Site Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking for players playing close left outside of A Cave on A Site.

data.title: B Main To Back B Site Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking for players on the close left side of Back B Site, ideally when B Main is smoked off.

data.title: Quick Flash For Mid Top From Mid Nest
data.description: Here's a great quick flash for players pushing out of B Elbow into Mid Top, that's better than a standard quick flash. It's mainly useful to break up the Attackers push up Mid Top, creating the opportunity for you to potentially get a pick and then get out. Having a teammate set up in B Tunnel to further capitalize on this flash can increase it's effectiveness as well.

data.title: Simple Mid Wood Doors Guiding Light For Mid Pillar
data.description: This is a great multi-purpose flash to poke and pressure players in Mid Pillar, that may be more effective than a standard quick flash outside of the Mid Wood Doors.

data.title: Quick Guiding Light For Back A Site From A Bridge
data.description: This basic quick Guiding Light is great for flashing players in Back A Site.

data.title: Defender Side A Hall Doors To A Site Pop Flash Setup
data.description: There are several ways you can Pop Flash A Site through the opening in the ceiling close to the A Metal Doors in Defender Side A Hall. These two setups in particular are great for flashing players pushing into A Site, as long as you don't flash your own teammates. They are not beginner level flashes though, so they may require some practice in customs to perfect.

data.title: Defender Spawn To B Site Pop Flash For B Main Push
data.description: This is a great Pop Flash to flash the attackers as they push out of B Main into B Site. It is not a beginner level flash though, so it may require some practice in customs to perfect.

data.title: Early Round B Tunnel To B Elbow Trailblazer
data.description: This is useful for checking for players in and around B Elbow immediately after the round begins. Be careful though since you may be in a vulnerable position if players were to push into B Site, and then push up Mid or B Elbow at the same time.

data.title: Support Guiding Light To Peek B Elbow / Mid Pillar
data.description: This is useful for helping your teammates to peek B Elbow from Mid Nest, but this can also be useful in peeking Mid Pillar if you can land the flash well enough to flash the side of Mid Pillar closest to Mid Wood Doors.

data.title: Quick Early Round Seekers To Check A Side Of Map
data.description: This is useful since the Seekers used from this position after opening the A Lever Door can go down A Hall, go out of Mid Wood Doors into Mid, or Travel Toward A Cave, letting you know where the three closest players to you are on the side of A on the map.

data.title: Early Round A Switch Trailblazer For A Hall / A Rope
data.description: This is useful for quickly checking for players in A Hall and A Rope immediately after the round begins.

data.title: B Site Trailblazer From Tree
data.description: Enable your teammates with this simple Trailblazer pathing, clear close angles for your teammates entrying on site.

data.title: Start Round Arcade Control Guiding Light Lineup
data.description: Here's a great, but simple flash you can throw at the start of the round to gain information on Defenders at Arcade. Consequently, you can commit more resources without risk.

data.title: Upper / Lower A Site Trailblazer Pathing From A Main
data.description: This Trailblazer pathing is great for clearing out all of Lower / Upper A Site from A Main.

data.title: Aggressive A Hall Flash To Push A Main
data.description: This Guiding Light from A Hall is difficult for Defenders who have pushed into A Main to react to, and is great for creating opportunities to push into A Main.

data.title: A Drop Trailblazer Pathing To Clear Lower / Upper A Site
data.description: This Trailblazer pathing is great for clearing out all of Lower / Upper A Site from A Drop.

data.title: Early Dish Guiding Light For Info
data.description: Here's a simple, yet effective info flash you can use to confirm information on any Attackers towards the second spawn.

data.title: Aggressive Sands Guiding Light Through Door
data.description: Use this pop flash to enable yourself a favorable fight towards A Main. In addition, your teammates from deep A Main can fight off this play.

data.title: Off Angle Quick Flash For B Site From B Generator
data.description: This is a useful off angle Guiding Light that makes it much more difficult for Attackers pushing into B Site to play anti-flash, allowing you to catch players pushing into B Site off guard. Try not to get caught with a Flash in your hand by players like Jett as they dash into Site, however!

data.title: Early Round Trailblazer / Flash Combo For A Main From A Rope
data.description: This is a great aggressive early round Trailblazer / Guiding Light Combo to take space in / pressure A Main from A Rope.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round A Main Flash
data.description: This early round Guiding Light is great for aggressively pushing into A Main, typically toward the beginning of the round.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round Flash From B Main For B Tree
data.description: This early round Guiding Light is great for aggressively pushing into B Tree, typically toward the beginning of the round.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round Peek With Flash In B Arcade
data.description: This is a great early round strat to catch players pushing into B Arcade off guard, or at the very least challenge them as they push into B Arcade from B Bench. This might work well with a teammate peeking into B Arcade from the B Generator Spawn Barrier or from B Tower.

data.title: B Main Trailblazer to Clear Close B Main Angles
data.description: Here's a simple, but very effective Trailblazer, that is typically used toward the beginning of the round to clear out the close B Main angles behind Pillar and the B Main Pocket.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round A Main Flash
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective early round A Main flash for A Main. This flash can be used to make it difficult for the enemy team to take space in A Main, making it easier for your team to take that space if it is contested.

data.title: A Site Retake Flash from A Flowers
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Guiding Light for A Site from A Flowers.

data.title: Support Flash from B Link for B Main
data.description: Here's a great flash from B Link for B Main that can be used to briefly delay the Attacker's push through B Main into B Site, or to create opportunities for your teammates to get picks on players pushing up through B Main.

data.title: Info Flash for A Main + A Restaurant
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective info flash from the A/Mid Connector to check for players on the Attacker side of A Main, and A Restaurant.

data.title: C Site Execute Trailblazer Variations
data.description: Use these Trailblazer Variations when pushing into C Site with your team. Just be careful of the flank, and enemy players opening C Door behind you.

data.title: Early Round B Main Guiding Light + Execute Trailblazer
data.description: Use this Guiding Light to push back enemy players inside of or holding an angle into B Main, and then if your team pushes up B Main and is getting ready to push into B Site, use your Trailblazer to lead the Site execute.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round C Main Info Flash
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective aggressive info flash for C Main.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round A Main Info Flash
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective info flash for A Main.

data.title: Quick C Link to C Main Guiding Light to Support C Hold / Retake
data.description: Use this Guiding Light when rotating to C to catch enemy players pushing through C Main off guard and support your team.

data.title: Early Round A Main Info Flash
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective info flash for A Main.

data.title: Early Round C Lobby Info Flash
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Guiding Light from C Main for C Lobby.

data.title: Garage Doors to Garage Window Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to blind enemies playing Garage Window and Garage Tunnel.

data.title: A Sewers to A Site Blindside
data.description: This is a good flash to blind anyone playing Graffiti, A Site and A Heaven.

data.title: A Lobby to A Long Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside for pushing A Long. This will allow you to blind enemies peaking you from A Long with an op or holding the angle with a rifle.

data.title: A Entrance to A Graffiti
data.description: This is a good blindside for retaking A Site. This flash blinds anyone peaking A Entrance or playing in the corner of A Graffiti.

data.title: A Link to A Site Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to blind enemies pushing A Site or to assist teammates during a retake.

data.title: Left Default A Site Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to blind anyone pushing A Site allowing you to swing and take aggression or to fall back and prepare to retake.

data.title: A Link to B Site Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to retake B Site from A Link.

data.title: B Heaven To B Site Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for flashing players playing under B Heaven, B Main, and behind the pillar on B Site, making it easier for you and your team to take or retake the site.

data.title: Mid Top To B Mail Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for flashing players holding the close corner in Mid Mail and the entrance of B Heaven, allowing you to clear the corner safely.

data.title: B Mail To B Heaven Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for flashing players holding in B Heaven.

data.title: A Main To A Site Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for flashing players playing A Rafters, under A Rafters, and A Screens, making it easier for you and your team to take the site.

data.title: Defender Spawn to B Site Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for retaking B Site from CT Spawn and will flash the majority of the site.

data.title: B Site To B Garage Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for flashing players in B Main.

data.title: A Screens To A Site Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for flashing incoming players in A Main, giving you an opportunity to get some easy kills.

data.title: A Heaven To A Site Blindside
data.description: This Blindside is useful for flashing incoming players in A Site when A Heaven is smoked off.

data.title: A Heaven To Right Side Generator Blindside
data.description: A easy Blindside to help you clear out the right lane of A Site, this blinds anyone behind generator or near the door switch!

data.title: B Main Window Blindside
data.description: A great early round blindside flash to help you fight and keep control of B Main early!

data.title: A Default To A Tree Blindside
data.description: This is a perfect pop flash for A Tree to help your team defend and or fight anyone in the area!

data.title: A Heaven Retake Blindside
data.description: A great pop flash for generators to retake A Site with your team!

data.title: A Heaven To A Garden Blindside
data.description: This blindside is perfect for retaking A Garden as ever player will be fully blind!

data.title: B Garage to B Yellow Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to blind anyone holding B Garage from B Yellow allowing you to swing and get the initial pick.

data.title: Mid Blue to Mid Boiler Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to flash anyone playing Mid Boiler and allow your team to push B Oranges or to peak and get a frag on enemies playing Mid Boiler.

data.title: A Site to A Screens Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to flash anyone playing A Screens or A Rafter.

data.title: A Nest to A Site Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to blind enemies behind A Site allowing your team to push and execute.

data.title: A Site Generator Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to blind enemies pushing A Site or to get information on enemies peaking A Site.

data.title: A Screens to A Site Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to retake A Site or to assist your teammate on A Site during an execute from your enemy.

data.title: B Orange to Mid Blue Blindside
data.description: This is a good blindside to blind anyone pushing Mid Blue allowing you to get an early peak or to assist a teammate being pinned down in Mid Boiler.

data.description: This is a good Gatecrash to get into Defender Spawn and flank onto B Site and open it up for your team.

data.title: B Site to Attacker Spawn Gatecrash
data.description: This is a good Gatecrash to go from B Site to Attacker Spawn. This allows you to flank Mid and both bomb sites.

data.title: A Tunnel to B Wall Gatecrash
data.description: This is an incredible Gatecrash to rotate to B Site from A Site.

data.title: A Pyramid to A Cave Blindside
data.description: This is a good Blindside to flash enemies pushing onto A Site or to blind enemies playing in A Cave delaying a push.

data.title: A Hall to Attacker Spawn Gatecrash
data.description: This is a good Gatecrash to get into Attacker Spawn and flank Bottom Mid along with both A Site and B Site.

data.title: Off Angle Blindside From B Site For B Generator
data.description: Here's a great Blindside from B Site for B Generator that is difficult to counter.

data.title: B Site Post Plant Gatecrash From B Tree
data.description: Here's a Gatecrash post plant setup from B Tree for behind the boxes on B Site.

data.title: A Site Post Plant Teleport Setup For A Main
data.description: Here's a Gatecrash post plant setup for the corner plant spot that's visible on the left side of the Lower A Site Spike Plant area when peeking into Site from A Main.

data.title: A Side Defender Spawn Gatecrash Lineup From B Generator
data.description: Here's a Gatecrash lineup from B Generator for A Side Defender Spawn.

data.title: Off Angle Blindside From B Generator To Retake B Site
data.description: Here's a great Blindside from B Generator for retaking B Site that is difficult to counter.

data.title: Early Round B Tree Blindside From B Main
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective early round Blindside from B Main for B Tree.

data.title: B Canteen Gatecrash Lineup From A Side Defender Spawn
data.description: Here's a Gatecrash lineup from A Side Defender Spawn for B Canteen.

data.title: A Site Execute Blindside from A Main
data.description: Here's a very effective Blindside for executing onto A Site from A Main. Combo'ing this with a Fakeout can be especially useful.

data.title: A Hall Gatecrash + Blindside Combo
data.description: Here's a very effective Gatecrash + Blindside Combo from B Main, that allows you to challenge B Hall. Just be careful of enemy players playing a close angle in B Hall.

data.title: Quick Rotation Gatecrash to Water from Mid Connetor / Mid Doors
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective quick rotation Gatecrash to Water from Mid Connector / Mid Doors.

data.title: Early Round Mid Top Blindside from A Art
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective Blindside that you can use to peek Mid Top from A Art at the beginning of the round.

data.title: Mid Doors Blindside to Peek Mid Plaza
data.description: Here's a Blindside that you can use to quickly peek into Mid Plaza. Be of enemy players playing anti flash from A Shop, and be extra careful of peeking out far enough to be challeneged by players peeking from Mid Top.

data.title: A Rubble Gatecrash Lineup for Defender Spawn
data.description: Use this Gatecrash lineup to force enemy players into uncomfortable positions either after you fake teleport, or teleport when you have a good opportunity to teleport unharmed.

data.title: Push into C Main with this Blindside
data.description: Use this Blindside to flash enemy players playing most of the commonly held angles inside of C Main.

data.title: B Site Retake Blindside from C Link
data.description: Use this Blindside when retaking space on B Site, if enemy players are holding mostly far angles from you, or are pushing into Site through the B Main or A Link chokepoints that connect with B Site.

data.title: C Main Blindside to Peek from C Site Arches
data.description: Use this Blindside to flash enemy players pushing through C Main toward C Site.

data.title: Early Round A Main Teleport Push Setup
data.description: Use this setup to catch enemy players off guard in A Main as they push out of the A Main Spawn Barrier.

data.title: Pre-Round A / B Gatecrash Lineup from C
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective pre-round A / B Side Gatecrash lineup from C.

data.title: Pre-Round C Gravel Gatecrash Lineup from A / B
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective pre-round C Gravel Gatecrash lineup from A / B.

data.title: Early Round Mid Window Support / Info Denial Nebula
data.description: Use this Nebula to limit the options of Attackers in Mid, and create opportunities for your teammates in that area of the map.

data.title: A Support Nebula + Gravity Well to Push A Long
data.description: Using your Nebula + Gravity Well like this can be a great way to support your teammates on the Side of A, since it makes it easier for them to push up A Long with the goal of stopping Attackers from pushing through A Long.

data.title: Simple B Main Gravity Well Post Plant
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective B Site Gravity Well post plant setup that can be played from B Main.

data.title: Simple A Site Post Plant Gravity Well
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective post plant Gravity well Setup for A Site that you can use when playing from almost anywhere on A that has vision of A Site. Just be aware of utility that can be used to block your vision or create windows of opportunity for the enemy team to defuse the Spike.

data.title: Standard A Site Execute Nebula Placements
data.description: Here are the default smokes for an A Site execute. Follow how the smokes are placed on screen to best limit the Defender's options.

data.title: B Split Star Placements Through Mid
data.description: Place your stars like this when doing a B Split.

data.title: Standard B Site Execute Nebula Placements

data.title: Hold B Main and B Tower Like This
data.description: Use your Nebulas, Gravity Wells, and Nova pulses like this to hold down important chokepoints into B Site and B Tower by using the different variations shown in this video.

data.title: Hold A Main and A Tower Like This
data.description: Use your Nebulas, Gravity Wells and Nova Pulse like this to hold A Ramp and A Tower.

data.title: Simple B Site Post Plant Corner Gravity Well
data.description: Here's a simple, but effective B Site Post Plant Gravity Well.

data.title: Aggressive Catwalk Push Nebula
data.description: Use these Nebula to take space in mid, push up Catwalk, and either pressure or push into A Site through Tree with your team.

data.title: Standard B Site Execute Sky Smokes
data.description: Here are the default smokes for a B Site execute. Follow how the smokes are placed on screen to best limit the Defender's options.

data.title: Early Round Support in Mid for Duelists with Nebula
data.description: Use one of these Nebula variations to support your team's efforts to hold deeper sightlines into Mid and look for picks on Attackers peeking into Mid.

data.title: A Site B Site Chokepoint Hold Using Full Utility
data.description: Use all of your standard pieces of utility to hold down the B Main chokepoint, or at least break up the Attackers push into B Site.

data.title: B Site Chokepoint Hold Using Full Utility
data.description: Use all of your standard pieces of utility to hold down the B Main chokepoint, or at least break up the Attackers push into B Site.

data.title: A Nest to A Default Cosmic Divide
data.description: This is a good cosmic divide to cut off the front of A Site from the back of A Site allowing your teammate to plant the bomb.

data.title: B Site Cosmic Divide
data.description: This is a good cosmic divide to separate the front of B Site and the back of B Site.

data.title: A Nest to A Site Corner Nova Pulse
data.description: This is a good nova pulse to concuss enemies playing in A Ramp Corner allowing you to swing and get a frag.

data.title: B Green to B Site Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula combo to block off all angles on B Site allowing your teammate to plant the bomb without being seen.

data.title: A Nest to A Pipes Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula to block a common angle that people like to op. Placing your smoke ontop of A Pipes allow you to block the angle and push up with your team and execute the site.

data.title: B Green Dissipate Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula to dissipate to sneak up B Green and allow you to successfully get a flank off.

data.title: B Green Gravity Well
data.description: This is a good gravity well lineup to clear both of the corners at the box of B Green.

data.title: Mid Blue to Mid Boiler Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula to block off mid boiler and allow your team to take control of middle.

data.title: A Site Nova Pulse
data.description: This a good nova pulse to concuss an enemy playing on A Site allowing you to get a pick and take A Site.

data.title: A Nest to A Generator Gravity Well
data.description: This is a good gravity well to pull enemies out of the generator corner of A Site and allow you to get a quick and easy kill.

data.title: Mid Boiler to Mid Blue Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula for Mid Blue to pull smoke off enemies and delay a mid push.

data.title: B Green Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula to create a one-way smoke on-top of B Green.

data.title: A Site Cosmic Divide
data.description: This is a good cosmic divide for A Site that allows you to cut off enemies protecting the bomb.

data.title: A Screens to A Default Gravity Well
data.description: This is a good gravity well to pull enemies off the bomb or stop a plant.

data.title: A Site to A Pipes Gravity Well
data.description: This is a good gravity well for A Pipes to stop a push onto A Site.

data.title: B Site Retake Cosmic Divide
data.description: This is a good cosmic divide location to prevent the enemies from hearing the defuse. This will also make it so if enemies want to peek you they will have to cross through the wall giving you ample time to stop defusing and shoot back.

data.title: A Site to A Pipes Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula to create a one-way smoke on A Pipes. This will allow you to get an advantageous angle on your opponent.

data.title: B Site to B Green Nebula
data.description: This is a good nebula to one-way smoke B Green and allow you to get an advantageous angle on your enemies pushing up.

data.title: B Site Execute To Push Left Side Of Site
data.description: This B Site Execute is great for aggressively challenging and / or taking control of back B Site.

data.title: Mid Nest Op Gap Smoke Setup
data.description: This smoke in Mid Nest is useful for more freely pushing into Mid. But, under ideal circumstances this can also be a great setup to bait players into a spot that you and your teammates can spray through smoke.

data.title: A Site Execute To Push Right Side Of Site
data.description: This A Site Execute is great for aggressively challenging and / or taking control of back A Site.

data.title: A Metal Doors Gravity Well Nova Pulse Combo
data.description: This is useful for forcing players out from behind A Metal Doors, and if they are hit by both the Nova pulse and the Gravity Well they will be forced out into an extremely vulnerable position.

data.title: A Hall / A Rope To Left A Lever Gravity Well Nova Pulse Combo
data.description: This is useful for forcing players out from behind the corner on the left side of A Lever.

data.title: Nebula For Above / Below A Bridge
data.description: This is useful for blocking vision on A Bridge and below A Bridge. Make sure to place the smoke in the dead center of the front-most part of the bridge so that players cannot peek out of the smoke in any way, and have to use the most utility possible, and apply the most effort possible, while being at the highest disadvantage, to be able to push out of or peek out of the smoke.

data.title: Front B Site Elbow Close One-Way Smoke Setup
data.description: This is a useful setup to hold the Elbow in Back B Site that is close to B Main.

data.title: Aggressive Two Person Play To Take A Shop Orb
data.description: This somewhat risky two person play to take the A Shop Orb can make it more difficult for the Attackers to freely play that area of the map, as well as force them to use more resources than they would otherwise if they want to take shop in the future.

data.title: One-Off Two Person A Site Setup To Punish Overly Aggressive Teams
data.description: This two person one-off setup for A Site can be a useful way to catch players off guard, especially if they don't tend to place a smoke in-between the Pyramids.

data.title: Aggressive Early Round Eco Strat For B Elbow / Mid Cannon
data.description: This is a highly aggressive eco strat that's very risky, but has the potential to turn the tide of an eco round in your team's favor. Though, even if your team doesn't manage to win the round - the strat still may be worth the risk if you and your team can manage to do some damage to the enemy team's economy, or force them to use any of their ultimate abilities so that they can guarantee the round.

data.title: Front B Site Nebula Lurk Eco Strat
data.description: This is a risky but potentially rewarding eco strat, that may be hit or miss depending on how the enemy team responds to this play. This strat can turn the tide of a round in your team's favor, or do damage to the enemy team's economy.

data.title: A Hall Gravity Well Nova Pulse Combo For Inner A Hall Lurker
data.description: This is useful for pulling players out from the inner A Hall corner on the side of the Attackers.

data.title: Nebula One-Way To Peek Mid Pillar From Mid Nest
data.description: This is useful for stopping players from peeking Mid Nest from the side of Mid Pillar that is closest to B Elbow. Be careful when using this though since players can easily peek you from B Elbow if your teammates are not stopping the Attackers from pushing out of B Elbow into Mid Top.

data.title: A Pyramids Anti-Spike Plant Gravity Well
data.description: This is useful for delaying the Spike Plant on A Site for a short period of time. Make sure to place the Gravity well out of the zone that players can plant the Spike, and getting as much inside of the zone that players can plant the Spike as you are able to.

data.title: Star Placement Setup For B Main Choke Point Into B Site Combo With Killjoy
data.description: This Astra / Killjoy Utility Combo Setup for the B Main / B Site chokepoint is useful for making it difficult for the Attackers to push into B Site, since it is so difficult to get through this choke point and they either take lots of damage or become unable to push through this chokepoint after some of their teammates get picked off.

data.title: Gravity Well Nova Pulse Combo For Behind Tall Bricks On Cave Side A Site
data.description: This is useful for forcing players out from behind the tall bricks on Cave side of A Site Post-Plant.

data.title: B Main Anti-Post Plant Gravity Well Nova Pulse Combo
data.description: This is useful for stopping players from setting up Post-Plant lineups from behind the cover on the right side of B Main when looking into B Main from B Site.

Be sure to ask your teammates to use smokes and other utility to limit what enemy players can do in areas in Mid that the Defenders may spot you from, and attempt to control the enemy team's information in Mid.

data.title: Bottom Mid Lurk Rendezvous to Watch Rotations
data.description: Roughly follow this pathing, and use this Rendezvous to catch players rotating through Mid Market off guard. If no enemy players rotate through this area of the map, you may even be able to flank the enemy team later in the round, after your team has taken control of one of the Sites. Be sure to ask your teammates to use smokes and other utility to limit what enemy players can do in areas in Mid that the Defenders may spot you from, and attempt to control the enemy team's information in Mid.

data.description: Use this Rendezvous when you want to lurk into mid from the side of A. Just be sure not to do this if your team is not on the side of A as well.

data.title: A Main Boosted Rendezvous Angle
data.description: Boost yourself on top of the Tall box that sits inside of the the A Main Spawn barrier, and then use your teleport to escape from that angle after taking a shot at a player peeking into A Main. Though, be careful of utility like Raze's Paint Shells, or Breach's Aftershock being used pre-emptively on angle that Defenders commonly play near where your Rendezvous is set up after you get on top of the Tall Box.

data.title: A Top Off Angle Teleport from A Stairs
data.description: Use this A Top off angle Teleport from A Stairs to passively hold / gather information in A Main, and then hold an unexpected angle into A Site after teleporting - once you believe enemy players could have taken space in A Main or A Site. Use this as a reactive setup to enemy players not showing much presence on the side of A Site throughout the half, or enemy players hard hitting A Site consistently.

You can also combo this with other utility that can work in combination with your Seize ability.
